0.title: 38-yr-old climber dies on Mt Everest, was found in a sitting position
0.article_body: Ngimi Tenji Sherpa, a 38-year-old Nepali climber who summited Mount Everest several times, has died on the peak, expedition organisers said. He was carrying equipment uphill to Camp 2 and was found in a sitting position, still wearing his backpack. "His body has been brought down. There were no accidents, and initial medical check suggests high-altitude sickness," an official said.

1.title: Shot in real cockpit, was tough to shoot in confined space: Rakul on Runway 34
1.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, who'll be seen alongside Ajay Devgn in the film 'Runway 34', has revealed that they shot for the film in a real cockpit. "We got a real simulator...every button that you see is real. So whatever we were pressing was real," she added. Rakul further said it was tough to shoot in a confined space.

2.title: Wrestling is our oldest sport, not including it in CWG 2026 is wrong: Bajrang
2.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has criticised the decision of dropping wrestling from the initial sports programme list for the Commonwealth Games 2026. "The Commonwealth Games Federation will decide but the decision...is wrong to keep wrestling, shooting and archery out. Wrestling is our oldest sport in the Games and keeping it out is not right," said the 28-year-old wrestler.

3.title: He's one of the best batters in IPL: GT pacer Ferguson on Buttler
3.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler, GT pacer Lockie Ferguson said the RR opener is one of the best batters in IPL. "The way he was batting (against GT), there's not a lot you can do when a guy's batting that well," he added. Ferguson bowled a yorker to dismiss Buttler (54) in GT's 37-run win against RR in IPL 2022.

4.title: My conclusion, Musk is f****** with SEC: Cuban on his Twitter bid
4.article_body: US billionaire investor Mark Cuban while discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter bid, said, "My conclusion, Elon Musk is f****** with...SEC." "His filing with the SEC allows him to say he wants to take a company private for $54.20," Cuban wrote, comparing the bid to Musk's tweet about taking Tesla private at $420 that landed him in trouble with SEC.

5.title: Hyd's EFLU to help develop communication skills of IAS trainees
5.article_body: The English and Foreign Languages University (EFLU) in Hyderabad has signed an MoU with the Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration (LBSNAA) to teach and refine the professional communication skills of IAS trainees. The pact will enable the university to design and offer intensive training programmes to the trainees. EFLU called the signing of the MoU a "momentous occasion".

6.title: I'd go on field after watching video of Rohit batting, can call it superstition: Jitesh
6.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma, who was with Mumbai Indians in 2016 and 2017, revealed that he used to go on the field after watching video of Rohit Sharma batting. "You can call this a superstition maybe, but this is what I would do before getting down to playing. I genuinely enjoy watching him bat," Jitesh added.

7.title: CSK's ₹14-crore buy Deepak Chahar ruled out of IPL 2022
7.article_body: Pacer Deepak Chahar, who was bought by CSK for ₹14 crore in mega auction, has been ruled out of IPL 2022. The 29-year-old fast bowler was recovering from a quadriceps tear at NCA in Bengaluru to get fit for IPL 2022. However, he suffered a fresh injury in his back, which has made him unavailable for the entire tournament.

8.title: India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 yrs: RSS chief Bhagwat
8.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 years. He made the comment in response to Akhil Bharatiya Akhara Parishad chief Mahant Ravindra Puri's statement that astrological predictions suggest the Akhand Bharat dream will be realised in 20-25 years. "You spoke about 20-25 years, but if we increase our speed, I say 10-15 years," Bhagwat added.

9.title: France to 'very soon' move its embassy in Ukraine back to Kyiv
9.article_body: France will "very soon" move back its embassy in Ukraine to the capital Kyiv from the western city of Lviv, French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian told his Ukrainian counterpart Dmytro Kuleba during a call. The embassy was moved to Lviv last month as conditions worsened on the ground after Russia invaded Ukraine. Russian forces have reportedly withdrawn from Kyiv.

10.title: Using rummy to explain integers wrong: PMK leader on class 6 maths chapter
10.article_body: Former Union Minister and Pattali Makkal Katchi leader Anbumani Ramadoss urged the Tamil Nadu government to remove integers chapter from the class 6 mathematics book. "The motive of the integers chapter might be to explain numbers to students...Using a rummy game to explain integers is wrong, it will not teach numbers but only how to play rummy," he said.

11.title: Viral video shows woman casually talking on phone right after train passes over her
11.article_body: A video of a woman calmly talking on her phone right after a train passed over her has gone viral. The video was posted on Twitter by IPS officer Dipanshu Kabra. "Gossiping on the phone is more important," Kabra said in his Twitter post accompanying the video. "Pick her up and put her behind bars," a Twitter user commented.

12.title: Blood money is being used to purchase Russian oil: Zelenskyy
12.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accused European countries which continue purchasing Russian oil of "earning their money in other people's blood". Zelenskyy criticised Hungary and Germany for preventing an oil embargo. "We don't understand how you can make money out of blood," he said. "The US, the UK, some European countries, they are trying to help and are helping," he added.

13.title: Cardi B, Offset share 1st pics of 7-month-old son, name him Wave Set Cephus
13.article_body: Cardi B and her rapper-husband Kiari Kendrell Cephus, professionally known as Offset, took to their respective Instagram accounts to share the first pictures of their 7-month-old son. "Wave Set Cephus," Offset captioned the picture as he revealed the name of their son. "When [Offset] suggested Wave, I was sold! THAT HAD TO BE HIS NAME," Cardi wrote on Twitter.

14.title: Ranbir wanted that I explain all rituals during wedding: Pandit Rajesh Sharma
14.article_body: Pandit Rajesh Sharma, who performed nuptials at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding ceremony, said that Ranbir wanted him to explain all rituals in the wedding. "Ranbir and I recently met at Shamshera's muhurat. That is when he said you will perform my wedding rituals," Sharma said, adding that the wedding ceremonies concluded by 5:20 pm on April 14.

15.title: K'taka AAP demands arrest of state minister KS Eshwarappa
15.article_body: The Karnataka unit of AAP has demanded state Minister KS Eshwarappa's arrest in connection with the death of contractor Santosh Patil. "The resignation alone of KS Eshwarappa is not enough, he should be arrested immediately and all the scams in his...department must be thoroughly investigated," said AAP state President Prithvi Reddy. Notably, Congress has also demanded the BJP leader's arrest.

16.title: Bangladeshi teen sneaks into India to buy chocolate, arrested
16.article_body: A Bangladeshi teen was arrested in Tripura for illegally crossing into India, the Border Security Force said on Friday. The accused would regularly swim across Shalda river and enter India to buy his favourite Indian chocolate from a shop in Kalamchoura village. He would sneak through a hole in the barbed wire fencing and would return home the same way.

17.title: Hardik Pandya gets entangled facing spinners: Wasim Jaffer
17.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said GT captain Hardik Pandya gets "entangled" while facing spinners as he has not batted at the number four position before IPL 2022. "There is...pressure on Shubman Gill to spend more time on the crease and [he] is doing the bulk of the scoring," added Jaffer. "GT are dependent on...two to three batters," stated Jaffer.

18.title: Elon is distracted, he's got a lot going on: Tesla investor exec
18.article_body: Amid the ongoing news surrounding Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion offer to buy Twitter, Tesla investor Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster said, "Elon is distracted. He's got a lot of things going on. He's involved in a lot of different endeavours." "This is a one to three months headwind to Tesla's stock," he added.

19.title: Don't know who is saying so: Hardik denies reports of leaving Cong
19.article_body: Gujarat Congress leader Hardik Patel has denied rumours of him leaving the party. "There is a rumour that I am leaving Congress, I do not know who is spreading so," Patel said. "There will be small fights...within the party, but we have to work together to make Gujarat a better place," Patel, who joined the Congress in March 2019, said.

20.title: 60-yr-old ex-serviceman killed in hit and run accident in Mohali
20.article_body: A 60-year-old ex-serviceman was killed in a hit and run accident near Dappar toll plaza in Mohali's Lalru on Wednesday evening. Identified as Muni Ram, the victim was crossing the road near Gurpreet Dhaba at 9:15 pm when a Toyota Innova coming from Ambala hit him. He was rushed to a civil hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

21.title: COVID-19 cases, deaths drop to lowest levels yet in Africa: WHO
21.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Thursday said the number of COVID-19 cases and deaths reported in Africa has dropped to its lowest levels since the pandemic began. WHO said less than 20,000 new cases and 239 deaths were reported in the last week, a decline of 29% and 37% respectively compared to the week before.

22.title: IMD predicts fresh spell of heatwave in Delhi, Haryana and Rajasthan till April 19
22.article_body: The IMD has warned of a severe heatwave sweeping across parts of Rajasthan from April 17 to 19 and over Delhi, Chandigarh and Haryana on April 18 and 19. The IMD announced on Friday that these regions are experiencing the third heatwave of this season. This comes after a prolonged heatwave spell came to an end nearly three days ago.

23.title: Bengaluru Police chief to hold Q&A session on Twitter tomorrow
23.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said that he will hold a live question and answer (Q&A) session on Twitter with the city's residents on Saturday.  The city police chief has asked people to share their grievances, ideas and suggestions with him using the hashtag #AskCPBlr. Notably, the session will be held from 11 am to 12 pm.

24.title: Twitter weighs 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Musk from raising stake: Report
24.article_body: Twitter's board is considering adopting a 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Elon Musk from raising his stake in the company significantly, Bloomberg reported. The strategy allows existing shareholders to buy more shares at a discount, effectively diluting the hostile party's stake. In a TED interview, Musk said "there's a plan B" if Twitter rejects his offer to buy the company.

25.title: Body of student killed in Canada to be brought to India tomorrow
25.article_body: The body of 21-year-old Kartik Vasudev, who was shot dead in Canada, will be brought to Delhi on Saturday, his father Hitesh Vasudev said on Friday. "Toronto Police has said that the accused has been produced before the court and has been asked to hire a lawyer because of which next hearing is on April 20," his father added.

26.title: Glad it happened with a senior like Ashwin: Dasgupta on being retired out
26.article_body: Reacting to Ravichandran Ashwin being retired out in RR's match against LSG, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Deep Dasgupta said he is glad it happened with a senior player like Ashwin. "[Retiring out] can be easily done and should be done...We can see it more in the future," added Dasgupta. "The game is going towards...clarity of thought and specialisation," stated Dasgupta.

27.title: Canada to deploy 150 troops to Poland to support refugees: Anand
27.article_body: Defence Minister Anita Anand on Thursday said Canada will deploy 150 military personnel to Poland to support Ukrainian refugees fleeing Russia's invasion. "Our people will provide general support, spiritual services and limited medical care enabled by Ukrainian-speaking Canadian Armed Forces personnel," she said. Over 4.6 million people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began on February 24.

28.title: Must be careful of EV push, it raises dependency on few nations: BMW
28.article_body: BMW CEO Oliver Zipse warned firms of the EV push, adding there was still a market for combustion engine cars. "When you look at the technology coming out, the EV push, we must be careful because at the same time, you increase dependency on very few countries," Zipse said. He highlighted that China mostly controls battery raw materials' supply.

29.title: Mumbai Dabbawalas take 5-day break 1st time after 2 years of COVID-19
29.article_body: Mumbai Dabbawalas have gone on a five-day break for the first time after two years of the COVID-19 pandemic to celebrate the Dev Khandoba Festival. 95 per cent of the dabbawalas have reportedly reached their villages for the celebrations since Tuesday. Reports said that dabbawalas will be returning to duty by April 18.

30.title: Museum director calls for Parthenon marbles to be returned to Greece
30.article_body: The new director of the Acropolis Museum in Athens Nikos Stampolidis has called for the Parthenon marbles to be returned to Greece. The fifth century marbles were passed to the British Museum in 1817 after being stripped from the Parthenon temple in Athens in the early 1800s. The Parthenon temple was built to honour the patron goddess of Athens.

31.title: Ranbir, Alia won't have a wedding reception: Choreographer Rajendra Singh
31.article_body: Choreographer Rajendra Singh said in an interview that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will not host a wedding reception. "There's no reception. There must be rumours going on, but there's no reception," he said, adding, "Ranbir is shooting, Alia is working...Maybe tomorrow they have some house pooja, I've no idea. But as far as I know, there's no reception."

32.title: 2 killed, over 200 homes destroyed in wildfire in New Mexico
32.article_body: New Mexico State Police on Thursday said two people have been killed and over 200 homes have been destroyed by a wildfire in the US state of New Mexico. Officials said the blaze began on Tuesday. "We're trying to keep this fire as small as possible, especially because it's right in the community," Incident Commander Dave Bales said.

33.title: Desperate Putin may use low-yield nuclear weapons: US spy chief
33.article_body: The US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) Director William Burns warned that Russia's setbacks in its invasion of Ukraine could lead "desperate" President Vladimir Putin to resort to using a tactical or low-yield nuclear weapon. He added that the threat of Russia potentially using nuclear weapons "cannot be taken lightly", although there is little practical evidence to reinforce such a concern.

34.title: South Korea to drop most COVID-19 restrictions from next week
34.article_body: South Korea will drop most of its COVID-19 restrictions from next week including a midnight curfew on restaurants, coffee shops and indoor businesses. Authorities will also remove a 10-person limit on private social gatherings. Health Minister Kwon Deok-cheol on Friday said an outdoor mask mandate could be dropped over the next two weeks. Wearing of masks indoors will remain required.

35.title: 5 men gangrape tribal girl in West Bengal's Birbhum district
35.article_body: A tribal girl was allegedly gang-raped by five men in a village located in West Bengal's Birbhum district. According to the police, the incident took place when the minor and her boyfriend were returning home from a village fair. The five accused beat up the girl's boyfriend and then took turns to rape her, police said.

36.title: 5 arrested for gang-rape in Jharkhand's Ranchi
36.article_body: Five of the six accused of gang-raping a woman in Jharkhand's Ranchi were arrested on Thursday, police said. The search operation to arrest the sixth accused is on, police added. "The victim was on her way home with one of the accused when midway the accused called five of his friends...all of them allegedly raped the victim," police further said.

37.title: Air India starts restoring salaries, allowances to pre-pandemic levels
37.article_body:
With the aviation sector recovering due to the decline in COVID-19 cases, Air India is restoring salaries and various other allowances of its employees in a phased manner to pre-pandemic levels. 
As per Air India’s document, for the cabin crew and pilots, the flying allowance, special pay and wide-body allowance will be restored to pre-pandemic levels starting April 1.

38.title: U'khand cabinet gives nod to set up panel to draft Uniform Civil Code
38.article_body: The Uttarakhand cabinet has given nod to set up a panel comprising legal experts and stakeholders to work on the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the state. "Keeping our pre-poll promise, we cleared a proposal to constitute a committee to draft Uniform Civil Code at the very first meeting of our cabinet," CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said.

39.title: No citizen should face problems during rainfall in B'luru: BBMP chief
39.article_body: BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta has directed officials to attend to areas where complaints of waterlogging and traffic are reported in Bengaluru. Directing that no citizen should face problems during the rainfall, he said, "BBMP...should immediately reach places where trees/branches have fallen or wherever...rainwater gets blocked." There's a forecast of continued rain for the next three days in the city.

40.title: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari inaugurates open-air theatre in Pune
40.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari inaugurated an open-air theatre at the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute in Pune on Thursday. "I can imagine how satisfied and joyous those behind this open-air theatre are now that it is ready," Gadkari said at the event. Notably, the open-air theatre is built at the cost of ₹7 crore, entirely funded by the Firodia Trust.

41.title: Shouldn't bulldozers be used against those who trouble the poor: MP CM
41.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, while reacting to criticism from opposition over the demolition of houses of people accused of pelting stones in Khargone, asked, "Shouldn't bulldozers be used against those who trouble the poor?" "This government is softer than a flower for the public, but we will not let goons and criminals survive in the state," Chouhan added.

42.title: Residents in parts of Pune complain of water supply shortage
42.article_body: Residents in parts of Pune have recently complained of a shortage in the supply of water. Some residents have blamed mismanagement by authorities for the situation. "There is no pressure; we have to climb down four floors to get water from a common tap, which runs for 30 minutes and then we...have to buy water from tankers," a resident said.

43.title: Pic shows gathbandhan ceremony from Ranbir Kapoor & Alia Bhatt's wedding
43.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram Stories to share pictures of the gathbandhan ceremony from his wedding with Alia Bhatt. In the pictures, Ranbir's cousin Karisma is seen helping the couple tie the knot while Riddhima and Kareena are seen assisting. Ranbir and Alia got married in an intimate wedding ceremony on Thursday.

44.title: 1 dead, several injured in stone-pelting incident at temple in Odisha village
44.article_body: One person was killed and several others sustained injuries at a stone-pelting incident that took place between two groups from Durgaprasad and Deulapali villages in Odisha, during the 'Danda Yatra' on Friday, Nayagarh ASP said. He added that a case has been registered and the situation is under control. The incident took place at a Shiva temple in Sindhuria village.

45.title: Kangana Ranaut is a professional but I was extra careful with her: Arjun Rampal
45.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal, who shared screen space with actress Kangana Ranaut in 'Dhaakad', said that she is a complete professional but that he was "extra careful" with her. "I think we both got some great chemistry going on set", Rampal said, adding, Kangana had tested COVID positive during shoot of the movie and it had taken a toll on her.

46.title: Sundar's injury a big blow, Williamson's strike rate a concern: Manjrekar on SRH
46.article_body: Talking about eighth-placed SRH, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said that all-rounder Washington Sundar's hand injury, due to which he might miss upcoming two matches in IPL 2022, is a "big, big blow" to the franchise. He further said that SRH captain Kane Williamson's strike rate is a concern for the team, which will face KKR tonight.

47.title: Speak on inflation and not loudspeakers in mosque: Aaditya tells Raj Thackeray
47.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray reacted to the ongoing loudspeaker row and said, "Instead of removing loudspeakers, one should use the same to speak about rising inflation." "One should speak about petrol, diesel or CNG," he added. His statement comes after Raj Thackeray said, "Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3rd otherwise, we will play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers."

48.title: RR are always trying to question the status quo: Watson on Ashwin retiring out
48.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin becoming the first player to retire out in IPL, DC assistant coach Shane Watson said, "RR are always trying to question the status quo." Watson, however, stated that DC players won't get retired out, adding, "How do you learn as a batter to work through if you've a couple of balls where you aren't scoring runs?"

49.title: Vivek Agnihotri announce he is working on new film 'The Delhi Files'
49.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Friday tweeted that it is time for him to work on a new film 'The Delhi Files'. He wrote, "I thank all the people who owned #TheKashmirFiles. For last 4 yrs we worked very hard with utmost honesty & sincerity...It's important to make people aware of the GENOCIDE & injustice done to Kashmiri Hindus."

50.title: Kapoor saab, your wish has been fulfilled: Neetu on Ranbir's picture as groom
50.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor shared a picture of her and late actor Rishi Kapoor's son and actor Ranbir Kapoor as a groom after his wedding with actress Alia Bhatt. "This is dedicated to Kapoor saab. Your wish has been fulfilled," she wrote. Neetu had earlier shared pictures of the newly-wed couple on Instagram.

51.title: Delhi govt to form panel to consider revision of auto & taxi fares
51.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot has announced the formation of a committee to consider the revision of auto and taxi fares. Earlier, auto, taxi and cab drivers' associations warned the authorities to go on a strike from Monday if their demand for subsidy on gas prices wasn't met. Notably, CNG price was hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi yesterday.

52.title: Ranbir gets Alia's name written on hand with mehendi, pic viral
52.article_body: Pictures showing actor Ranbir Kapoor's heart-shaped mehendi design on his palm with wife Alia Bhatt's name are going viral on social media. The couple made their first appearance after their wedding on Thursday at Ranbir's Vastu residence. Alia's mehendi design featured an infinity symbol which is significant to their relationship. She also had the symbol in her mangalsutra and kaleera.

53.title: 44 kids test COVID-19 +ve in 1 week in Noida, 16 are below 18 yrs
53.article_body: The health department said on Friday that 44 children have tested positive for COVID-19 in the last week in Noida, Uttar Pradesh. Of them, 16 children are below 18 years. "Overall cases in Noida 167...The percentage of children affected is 26.3," the health department added. All schools have been asked to inform immediately if a child shows coronavirus-like symptoms.

54.title: NASA calls off its third attempt at Artemis 1 'wet dress rehearsal'
54.article_body: NASA called off the third attempt at 'wet dress rehearsal' for Artemis 1 mission on Thursday. Its attempt to fuel its huge moon rocket for a countdown test was thwarted by a hazardous hydrogen leak. The rocket's core stage liquid oxygen tank was about 49% filled and liquid hydrogen tank had been loaded to about 5% prior to the leak.

55.title: Israel successfully tests new laser missile defence system; shares video
55.article_body: Israel's Defence Minister Benny Gantz said Israel's new laser missile defence system has successfully intercepted UAVs, mortars, rockets, and anti-tank missiles in recent tests. The Israeli-made laser system will be operational "as soon as possible", and the goal is to deploy it around the country's borders over the next decade, he added. Gantz also shared a video of the tests.

56.title: Pant makes some weird noises while keeping and then says 'I was getting bored': Axar
56.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) all-rounder Axar Patel, while talking about Rishabh Pant, said that the wicketkeeper makes weird noises behind the stumps and then says, "I was getting bored." Axar added, "He'll randomly ask the fielder at point, 'Bro how's it going?' The person next to him [at slip] is always alert."

57.title: India-US need continued collaboration to face our 'biggest challenges': US
57.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "I believe firmly that US and India need continued collaboration, hard work and leadership for the biggest challenges both countries face." The challenges could include combating COVID-19, building a more inclusive global economy or tackling the climate crisis, he stated. He was speaking at the Howard University for India-US Education Collaboration.

58.title: 3 thieves get life term for killing police officer in 2012 in Mumbai
58.article_body: Three robbers were sentenced to life imprisonment by a Mumbai sessions court on Wednesday for killing a policeman, identified as Dattu Sarnobat, in 2012 when he tried to stop them from stealing a car in Mumbai. Sarnobat, an assistant sub-inspector, landed on the car's bonnet while trying to stop them but the accused drove away. He died of his injuries.

59.title: 36-yr-old woman gang-raped in Delhi, 3 arrested within 4 hours
59.article_body: A 36-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by three men in Delhi. All the three accused were arrested within four hours after committing the crime, police said on Friday. The accused have been identified as Naveen Singh Bhandari (28), Bishwa Mohan Acharya (26) and Akshay Taneja (30). Further investigation into the matter is underway, police said.

60.title: Right now there is 'hungama': Randhir on Alia-Ranbir wedding
60.article_body: Veteran actor Randhir Kapoor, speaking about his nephew actor Ranbir Kapoor's wedding with actress Alia Bhatt, said, "Nothing quiet now, abhi toh hungama hai (Right now there is uproar). Every day something is going on." Randhir further said they missed Ranbir's father late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor a lot at the wedding. Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

61.title: Anupam Kher touches younger brother's feet on film sets, says 'It was nice'
61.article_body: Anupam Kher shared some behind the scenes pictures from the sets of film 'Uunchai'. In one of the photographs, the actor can be seen touching the feet of his younger brother Raju Kher. "It was nice to touch my younger brother's feet in a scene in Sooraj Barjatya's...Uunchai. He was awkward but I got cheap thrills," Anupam captioned the pictures.

62.title: We're still a champion team: Suryakumar after MI's 5-match losing streak
62.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav said his side is still a champion team despite being at the bottom of IPL 2022 standings as they've lost all five matches they have played so far. "It's just a matter of a few games. The few people that have just joined in are doing really well," he added. MI will face LSG on Saturday.

63.title: Elon Musk is winning against GM, Ford, Toyota: Warren Buffett
63.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett in an interview with Charlie Rose said Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "winning" against his competitors like GM, Ford and Toyota. He said all the firms against Musk have "got all the stuff" and Musk has "got an idea". "And he's winning. That's America. You can't dream it up. It's astounding," Buffett added.

64.title: Police remove saffron flags put up by Hindu Sena near JNU campus
64.article_body: Delhi Police removed the saffron flags and banners put up by Hindu Sena near the Jawaharlal Nehru University campus on Friday. Hindu Senda members put up posters protesting against the violence that broke out between the students' groups on Ram Navami. National President of Hindu Sena Vishnu Gupta said that by removing the flags, the police have disrespected the Constitution.

65.title: Photographers dance after Alia, Ranbir make appearance post-wedding, video viral
65.article_body: A video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani shows photographers dancing after clicking pictures of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt in their wedding outfits. The photographers broke into a celebratory dance as soon as the couple went out of sight. The couple, who got married on Thursday at Ranbir's residence Vastu, wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for wedding ceremony.

66.title: RR haven't shown enough faith in Parag, Ashwin was sent ahead: Jaffer
66.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said RR have not shown enough faith in all-rounder Riyan Parag, adding that Ravichandran Ashwin was sent ahead of him in the match against LSG despite 10 overs left to bat. Parag recently stated that he can be the best finisher not just for RR but for India in the coming years.

67.title: 3 held for murder of MCOCA accused who was out on parole in Pune
67.article_body: Pune's Wanowrie Police have arrested three men for killing Sunny alias Girish Hiwale, who was released on parole on April 9. Sunny was shot to death by rival gang members near his house on April 12. Reportedly, Sunny had four criminal cases lodged against him and he was booked under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) in 2021.

68.title: Cow smuggling syndicate busted in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, 5 held
68.article_body: A cow smuggling syndicate was busted in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut and five accused have been arrested, police said. "During the interrogation, the accused disclosed that they used to smuggle cattle from different states and take them to Assam from where they were smuggled to Bangladesh," police added. Notably, Assam Police had announced a reward of ₹2 lakh on an accused.

69.title: Rapido raises $180 million led by Swiggy at $800 million valuation
69.article_body: Bike taxi startup Rapido on Friday announced that it has raised $180 million in funding led by homegrown food delivery startup Swiggy. TVS Motor Company and Rapido's existing investors Westbridge, Shell Ventures and Nexus Ventures also participated in the startup's Series D funding round. Founded in 2015, the Bengaluru-based startup is now valued at $800 million.

70.title: Tunisia detains female journalist who called police 'dogs'
70.article_body: A Tunisian court on Thursday detained a female journalist who criticised police and the Interior Minister Taoufik Charfeddine, the main journalism union said. Chahrazed Akacha, in a Facebook post, had reportedly accused police of insulting, beating her, and taking off her veil in the street. She had called on the Interior Minister to control his policemen, describing them as "dogs".

71.title: I had suicidal thoughts but not related to body issues: Ileana
71.article_body: Actress Ileana D'Cruz in an interview has stated that she had suicidal thoughts when she hit a really low point in her life, however, they were not related to her body issues. "Those are two separate issues so I didn't like the fact that they clubbed them together like that, 'Oh you know because she had body issues'," she added.

72.title: PMPML to celebrate April 18 as 'Bus Day', commuters to get discounts
72.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will celebrate April 18 as "Bus Day" by bringing in 1,800 buses on city roads. On April 19, it'll celebrate its foundation day and will provide the service at a concessional rate to all commuters. Buses will charge a minimum fare of ₹5 and a maximum fare of ₹10 in PMC and PCMC areas.

73.title: PM looks the same, what's your secret sir: Grammy winner Ricky on pics from 2015 & 2022
73.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian composer Ricky Kej shared pictures with PM Narendra Modi. He wrote, "7 year challenge!! Pic 1: 2015 when I won my 1st Grammy...Pic 2: 2022 when I won 2nd Grammy. Hon'ble PM @narendramodi ji looks EXACTLY the same...but I have aged a lot :-) hahahaha...What is your secret sir??" "Happy to have met you," PM Modi tweeted.

74.title: Vijay's 'Beast' crosses ₹100-crore mark globally in 2 days
74.article_body: Vijay's latest action film 'Beast' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark globally in just two days of its release, according to film trade analyst Ramesh Bala. In a tweet, Ramesh mentioned that the Hindi version of 'Beast' earned ₹50 lakh in India on day one. The film, which features Vijay as a RAW officer, was released in theatres on April 13.

75.title: Damn impressed by Hardik, he can lead India in shorter formats: Manoj Tiwary
75.article_body: Cricketer-turned-politician Manoj Tiwary said that he's "damn impressed" by GT captain Hardik Pandya's leadership, adding that he can lead India in shorter formats. Hardik scored 87*(52) against RR in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. GT jumped to top of the points table after their win against RR. They have won four out of their five matches.

76.title: Headless person with no limbs spotted walking in New York on Google Maps
76.article_body: Google Maps users have spotted a headless person with no limbs walking in a hazmat suit on a street in New York. Pictures from Google Maps shared online show the person in hazmat suit walking, dancing and playing tricks around the area. The area is said to be Brooklyn Navy Yard in New York City.

77.title: MI had a shocking auction, Kishan not worth blowing nearly your whole salary on: Watson
77.article_body: Talking about MI being placed last on the IPL 2022 points table, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said that he is not surprised as MI had a shocking auction. He added that MI shouldn't have spent so much money on Ishan Kishan. "He's a very talented and skilful player, but he’s not worth blowing nearly your whole salary on," Watson stated.

78.title: Musk asks Twitter users if taking Twitter private should be up to shareholders
78.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has started a poll on Twitter asking users whether the decision to take Twitter private should be up to the company's shareholders. "Taking Twitter private at $54.20 should be up to shareholders, not the board," the poll reads. Musk has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, saying it is his "best and final offer".

79.title: Kolkata traffic policeman teaches boy while on duty; pic surfaces
79.article_body: Kolkata Police has shared a picture of a traffic police officer teaching an eight-year-old boy while managing traffic as well and captioned it, "The teacher cop." The police said that Sergeant Prakash Ghosh had promised to help the boy after the latter's mother, who works at a roadside food stall, approached him. A local journalist had taken the picture.

80.title: Student injured as portion of bathroom ceiling collapses at JNU hostel in Delhi
80.article_body: A student was injured after a portion of a bathroom ceiling collapsed at Sabarmati Hostel of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), officials said. The injured student was taken to the Safdarjung Hospital for treatment. "This is a clear case of criminal negligence on part of the hostel wardens and the Dean of Students," an All India Students' Association activist said.

81.title: Bengaluru police help rescue doctor's pets after bank sealed home
81.article_body: Bengaluru police on Thursday rescued the pets of a doctor whose house was reportedly sealed by bank officials nearly a week ago after she defaulted on a home loan payment. An animal rights group member had posted about the incident on Twitter after the doctor approached the group. The pets included two cats, two tortoises and a large aquarium.

82.title: Police stop a driverless car for not having headlights on in US, video surfaces
82.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed police in San Francisco stopping a car driving without headlights, only to find that it was an autonomous vehicle with no one inside. The car was operated by Cruise, an autonomous car company backed by General Motors in the US. Cruise later said the headlights' issue was due to human error.

83.title: Kristen Stewart to star in romantic thriller 'Love Lies Bleeding'
83.article_body: Kristen Stewart has signed on to star in romantic thriller titled 'Love Lies Bleeding'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the actress will be seen playing the co-lead of the story. Directed by 'Saint Maud' maker Rose Glass, the film will be backed by A24 and Film4. The script of the film has been written by Rose Glass and Weronika Tofilska.

84.title: Court rejects actor Armaan Kohli's bail plea in drugs case
84.article_body: A special court in Mumbai rejected Armaan Kohli's bail application in drugs case. The actor was arrested by NCB in August last year over alleged possession of 1.2 grams of cocaine. Armaan had filed for bail on grounds that drugs recovered from him fall under small quantity under the NDPS Act and his co-accused had also been released on bail.

85.title: Germans should save energy to reduce reliance on Russia: Min
85.article_body: Germany's Economy Minister Robert Habeck said that Germans should start saving energy now to become more independent from Russian gas and oil. "Every kilometre not driven is a contribution to making it easier to get away from Russian energy supplies," he added. Germany is looking for ways to cut Russian oil and gas imports in response to the Ukraine war.

86.title: SP leader resigns citing Akhilesh's silence over 'atrocities against Muslims'
86.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Mohammad Kasim Raeen resigned from the party citing "no action" by Akhilesh Yadav and others against "rising incidents of atrocities meted out to Muslims" in UP. He said that the party is "not interested" in raising its voice against incidents like imprisonment of Azam Khan and his family and demolition of MLA Shazil Islam Ansari's petrol pump.

87.title: India to get record number of new doctors in next 10 years: PM Modi
87.article_body: India will get a record number of doctors in the coming 10 years, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Friday. "Whether it is the goal of building medical colleges in every district...or efforts to make medical education accessible to all, the country is going to get a record number of new doctors in the coming 10 years," he said.

88.title: Rock found in 2011 confirmed to be hottest rock on record: Study
88.article_body: The University of Western Ontario has said the rock found in 2011, which was then called the hottest rock on the planet, has been confirmed to be the hottest indeed. A recent study found four additional zircon grains in the rock that confirmed the rock's record-high temperature of 2,370°C. That rock was formed as a result of an asteroid impact.

89.title: 2 booked for playing pro-Pakistan songs in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly
89.article_body: Two persons identified as Naeem and Mustkim of Singhai Murawan village in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly have been booked for allegedly hampering national integration by playing pro-Pakistan songs. The accused reportedly played the songs on a mobile phone at high volume in a shop. They also picked up a fight with a resident who objected to it, police said on Thursday.

90.title: Joe Root steps down as England Test captain
90.article_body: Joe Root has stepped down as the captain of England men's Test team. "It has been the most challenging decision I've had to make in my career but having discussed this with my family and those closest to me; I know the timing is right," he said. Root was appointed Test captain in 2017. He led England in 64 Tests.

91.title: Shanghai officials assault citizens over vacating their houses for quarantine sites
91.article_body: A purported video has surfaced online that showed people wearing hazmat suits with the word  "police" on their back getting into violent fights and assaulting citizens in Shanghai, in order to get them to surrender their homes for COVID-19 quarantine facilities amid rising cases. A woman could also be heard weeping as she filmed the scene.

92.title: 14 IPS officers transferred in UP; Vikas Vaidya gets Hathras SP charge
92.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government transferred 14 IPS officers in the state on Friday. As per the new order, IPS Vikas Vaidya will replace Hathras Superintendent of Police (SP) Vineet Jaiswal who has been sent to Amroha. Meanwhile, Moradabad SSP Bablu Kumar and Amroha SP Poonam were removed and kept on the waiting list.

93.title: Raj Thackeray to hold 'maha aarti' in Pune tomorrow amid loudspeaker row
93.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray will hold a 'maha aarti' in Pune on Saturday, on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti. This comes amid Thackeray's demands seeking the removal of loudspeakers in mosques. Thackeray had earlier threatened to play 'Hanuman Chalisa' in front of mosques if loudspeakers in mosques were not silenced.

94.title: COVID-19 testing to be increased in Gurugram: Officials
94.article_body: With the surge in the number of COVID-19 cases in Gurugram, the state health department will increase COVID-19 testing in the district, health department officials said. About 3,000 to 4,000 samples will be tested every day, they added. The testing numbers were reportedly reduced to fewer than 1,500 samples a day after COVID-related restrictions were lifted in Gurugram.

95.title: China holds military drills around Taiwan as US delegation visits
95.article_body: China said it conducted military drills around Taiwan on Friday as a US Congressional delegation visited the China-claimed island. The operation is intended to target the "wrong signals" sent by US over Taiwan, People's Liberation Army Eastern Theater Command spokesman Shi Yilu said. He added the US' actions are "very dangerous" and "those who play with fire will burn themselves".

96.title: Saffron flags, 'Bhagwa JNU' posters put up outside campus by Hindu Sena
96.article_body: Hindu Sena members put up saffron flags and "Bhagwa JNU" posters outside Jawaharlal Nehru University campus on Friday which were later removed by the police. "Inside JNU, saffron...Hindutva are constantly being insulted," National President of Hindu Sena Vishnu Gupta said. Commenting on police action, Gupta added, "Even police should not be in such a hurry to take down saffron flags."

97.title: US links N Korean hackers to one of biggest crypto heists of $600 mn
97.article_body: The US has linked North Korean hackers to the theft of over $600 million from a blockchain network connected to the Axie Infinity online game in one of the biggest crypto heists to date. The FBI has attributed the hack to the Lazarus Group, the blockchain network said. The US Treasury has sanctioned the address that received the stolen funds.

98.title: Local admin doesn't invite me to govt events as I'm Dalit: BJP MP
98.article_body: BJP MP from Maharashtra's Latur Sudhakar Shrangare has accused the local administration of not inviting him to government events as he's a Dalit. This comes after a Dr BR Ambedkar statue was unveiled in the district by Union Minister Ramdas Athawale and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday. "I'm not invited purposely. They can't see my work," Shrangare said.

99.title: High cardiovascular risk associated with symptoms of depression: Study
99.article_body: As cardiovascular diseases and depression show similar risk factors like inflammation and oxidative stress, they might be closely related. As per new study, cardiovascular risk factors are linked with an increased risk of depression in older adults, especially in women. Though researchers suggest that depression could be a risk factor for these diseases, studies suggesting vice versa are scarce.

100.title: Hyderabad police arrest 2 people for betting on IPL matches
100.article_body: Hyderabad's Mangalhat Police arrested two people for betting on IPL matches and seized ₹41,500 cash, 2 cellphones and TV. According to police, accused Gopi Singh used to organise betting from his house in Mangalhat along with his friends, Anand Singh and Sonu. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided the location late on Tuesday night and arrested Gopi and Anand.

101.title: Bus driver assaulted in road rage incident on expressway in Greater Noida
101.article_body: A bus driver was allegedly assaulted by two men in a road rage incident on the Yamuna Expressway in Greater Noida. According to the police, one of the two accused is a cab driver. Notably, the police received the complaint through their Twitter handle, the Assistant Commissioner of Police (Greater Noida 3) Brijnandan Rai said.

102.title: 3 held including cousin for murder of 10 year old boy in Ghaziabad
102.article_body: The Ghaziabad Police arrested three persons on charges of kidnapping a 10-year-old boy, Harsh Singh, for ransom and later murdering him at a park in Noida on April 11. According to the police, among those arrested include Harsh's cousin, Priyanshu Singh, who allegedly executed the crime to extort ₹15 lakh from Harsh's family. The suspects are residents of Khoda, Ghaziabad.

103.title: 10-yr-old boy beaten by drunk criminal lawyer at housing society in Thane
103.article_body: A 10-year-old boy, resident of a housing society in Thane, was hospitalised after he was allegedly beaten by a criminal lawyer from the same society, while the latter was under the influence of alcohol. The incident took place when the victim was playing with his friends inside the society premises. He claimed the accused allegedly threatened to beat him again.

104.title: Left-arm pacer Arshdeep could be a great option for Team India: Parthiv
104.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said PBKS left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh could be a great option for Team India who need a left-arm pacer. "He was with Team India during the Sri Lanka series. Arshdeep is being recognised and he is improving day by day," added Parthiv. "Arshdeep is doing the job which is often difficult for a pacer," stated Parthiv.

105.title: Resignation not enough, arrest Eshwarappa: Cong on K'taka contractor's suicide
105.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar demanded arrest of state minister KS Eshwarappa in connection with the death case of contractor Santosh Patil and said that "resignation is not a solution". "A case of corruption has to be registered, then he (KS Eshwarappa) has to be arrested," Shivakumar said. The contractor's family has alleged that he was tortured, Shivakumar further added.

106.title: 3 shops, Ambedkar Jayanti stage hoardings gutted in fire in Pune
106.article_body: Three shops and hoardings on a stage set up for Ambedkar Jayanti were gutted in a fire near Pune's railway station on Thursday morning, officials said. Firefighters were able to bring the blaze under control and averted a major incident by removing five gas cylinders from one of the shops. The stage's rear side was close to the shops.

107.title: Delhi PWD to take up repair works along key roads stretching 254 km
107.article_body: Public Works Department (PWD) in Delhi will take up repair and strengthening works along key arterial roads stretching 254 kilometres, officials said. The department has received administrative approval for the work which will start in the coming days, a PWD official added. PWD has already commenced strengthening works along 171.68 kilometres of roads in the national capital, officials stated.

108.title: Indian Idol 12's Sayli Kamble to tie the knot with fiancé Dhawal on April 24
108.article_body: Sayli Kamble, the second runner-up on 'Indian Idol 12', is all set to tie the knot with her fiancé Dhawal on April 24. Speaking to ETimes, Sayli said that she's "very excited and waiting for the day". "All the preparations are done. Now we're just waiting for the big day," she added. Sayli and Dhawal got engaged in December 2021.

109.title: Indian-origin doctor found guilty of sexually abusing 48 patients over 35 yrs in Scotland
109.article_body: Krishna Singh, a 72-year-old Indian-origin doctor, has been found guilty of sexually abusing 48 female patients over 35 years in Scotland. He was accused of kissing, groping, giving inappropriate examinations and making sleazy comments. An investigation into his conduct was launched after one woman reported him in 2018. He was subsequently arrested and charged in April 2018.

110.title: Police call bomb threat to B'luru schools 'cyber terrorism': Report
110.article_body: Karnataka Police have filed a case under the Information Technology Act over hoax bomb threat emails to over 10 schools in Bengaluru, IANS reported. The police also reportedly called them acts of "cyber terrorism". Meanwhile, the city's Additional Police Commissioner (East Zone) said, "Once the miscreants behind the hoax bomb case get arrested, the intention and objectives will be known."

111.title: Vanguard Group replaces Musk as Twitter's largest shareholder with 10.3% stake
111.article_body: Days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk disclosed being the largest shareholder at Twitter with a 9.2% stake, the position has now been taken by US' Vanguard Group. In its recent publicly available filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, the company disclosed owning 82.4 million shares of Twitter, which means 10.3%. Vanguard's holdings are reportedly worth $3.78 billion now.

112.title: Jos Buttler smashes highest individual score in powerplay in IPL 2022
112.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler on Thursday smashed the highest individual score in powerplay in IPL 2022. The 31-year-old scored 54 runs off 24 deliveries during the powerplay against GT. He overtook DC's Prithvi Shaw, who had scored an unbeaten 47 off 27 deliveries in the powerplay against LSG. Robin Uthappa scored 45*(21) in powerplay against LSG.

113.title: Three die after drowning in dam while bathing in Chhattisgarh
113.article_body: Three people, including a woman, died after drowning in the Kukda dam in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband on Wednesday. The trio, identified as Rita Kumari, Lakshya Kumar and Rakesh Tete, had gone to the dam for a picnic and were bathing in the river at the time of the incident, police said. Their bodies were recovered with the help of local fishermen.

114.title: Out for playing with dad, 6-yr-old dies as garbage van crushes him in Gujarat
114.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after he was crushed under wheels of the garbage collection van of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC). The 22-year-old driver of the garbage van was later arrested. "The driver reversed the van without checking properly...The child, who was with his father...was crushed under the wheels and died on his way to hospital," police said.

115.title: Alia & Ranbir dance at their wedding afterparty, video goes viral
115.article_body: A video of Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor dancing at their wedding afterparty has surfaced online. In the clip, the couple can be seen dancing to the song ‘Chaiyya Chaiyya’. They tied the knot on April 14 in an intimate wedding at Ranbir’s residence Vastu. Alia while sharing photos from the wedding wrote, "Can't wait to build more memories together".

116.title: I feel lucky: Raghav on 'Teri Baaton' going viral after 18 years of release
116.article_body: Singer Raghav, whose song 'Teri Baaton' is trending on social media after 18 years of its release, said music that's made from the heart never fails to connect. "I feel lucky. The idea that music can revive to this degree after so long is...great compliment," he added. Reportedly, over 1.5 million reels have been made on the song so far.

117.title: Zelenskyy praises Ukrainians for withstanding 50 days of war
117.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy hailed his people for their resolve since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 and for making "the most important decision of their life- to fight". "We've withstood 50 days...50 days of Russian invasion, although the occupiers gave us a maximum of five," Zelenskyy said. Ukraine has become "a hero for the whole free world", he added.

118.title: PM Modi inaugurates KK Patel Super Speciality Hospital in Gujarat's Bhuj
118.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated KK Patel Super Speciality Hospital in Gujarat's Bhuj via video conferencing. The 200-bed hospital is the first charitable super speciality hospital in Kutch, the official statement said. "The hospital will make good quality healthcare accessible to people at an affordable price," PM tweeted. The hospital has been built by Shree Kutchi Leva Patel Samaj.

119.title: 7 children die due to suspected viral disease in Rajasthan's Sirohi
119.article_body: Seven children have died in the last few days due to a suspected viral disease in Rajasthan's Sirohi district. "These deaths have occurred due to a viral [disease]. A survey of the village has been done. The situation is now under control," state Health Minister Parsadi Lal Meena said. "Teams from Jaipur and Jodhpur have also reached there," Meena added.

120.title: Musk's Twitter bid probably not good for me: Teenager who tracked his jet
120.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracked Elon Musk's private jet, reacted to Musk's Twitter offer, saying, "Oh no. Probably good for Twitter but probably not me lol." "I mean if he really wanted to then he could shut me down," Sweeney told Business Insider. Earlier, Sweeney asked TED Head Chris Anderson to ask Musk what made him buy Twitter stock.

121.title: Rahane has been out of form for years, any team would've dropped him: Manjrekar
121.article_body: Talking about KKR batter Ajinkya Rahane, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said, "If Rahane had to be dropped on form, any team would have done it long back...He hasn't been in form for a few years now." "If KKR play Rahane, it will be in hope because he struggled a lot in the last game [against DC] too," added Manjrekar.

122.title: Alert sounded in Bihar's Supaul amid bird flu outbreak in village
122.article_body: An alert has been sounded in Bihar's Supaul following a bird flu outbreak in Chhapkahi village. Unnatural deaths of birds were reported on March 31, following which specimen of a duckling was sent to Bhopal for testing. "Within one kilometre of the area where the birds were found dead, culling of ducks and hens will be done," Supaul DM said.

123.title: BJP, AIMIM spreading communal violence in country: Congress leader
123.article_body: Congress leader Sajjan Singh Verma on Thursday blamed the BJP and AIMIM for spreading communal violence in the country. "BJP and...AIMIM played a crucial role in Khargone communal violence. They deliberately want to create an atmosphere of tension in India, "Verma said. He claimed that BJP never talks about real issues, adding, "They only want people to remember their religion."

124.title: Took risks, ensured it comes off unlike last game: Hardik on 52-ball 87*
124.article_body: Reacting to his unbeaten 87 off 52 balls against RR, GT captain Hardik Pandya said he took risks and ensured it comes off unlike the previous game against SRH, where he scored a 42-ball 50*. "I am not used to batting this long. It is difficult but now [batting at number four position] I can control the game," added Hardik.

125.title: Canada health officials mistakenly tweet Pornhub link instead of COVID-19 portal
125.article_body: The health ministry in Canada’s Quebec accidentally shared a link to an adult video from the Pornhub website featuring foot fetishes instead of sharing a link to the COVID-19 portal. The ministry deleted the tweet soon after and wrote, "Due to a situation beyond our control, a link with inappropriate content was posted on our Twitter...We're looking for the causes."

126.title: I wasn't allowed to enter temple for being Dalit: Former K'taka Deputy CM
126.article_body: Senior Congress leader and former Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister G Parameshwara has claimed that he wasn't allowed to enter a temple, despite his PhD qualification and the position he has held, as he is a Dalit. "They stopped me [outside] and brought 'mangala arati' there itself," Parameshwara said. "Such a system exists even today in this society," he added.

127.title: Sharad Pawar first to use the word 'Hindu terror': Devendra Fadnavis
127.article_body: Maharashtra ex-CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised NCP chief Sharad Pawar and said that his party has an old track record of "appeasement politics and polarising the society on communal basis". He further said that Pawar was the first person to use the word "Hindu terror". The NCP has grand plans on bringing a Muslim quota in Maharashtra, the BJP leader added.

128.title: 25-yr-old man murders lover over suspicion of an affair in Gujarat; held
128.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Gujarat's Chhotaudepur for allegedly murdering his 23-year-old girlfriend over suspicion of an affair. The accused, Karshan Rathwa had picked up the woman on his bike on Tuesday. "When she received a call...from another man...he (Rathwa) questioned her about the affair. They had a fight and he strangulated her on the spot," police said.

129.title: HC awards ₹2.5 cr compensation to family of accident victim who died
129.article_body: Bombay High Court awarded ₹2.5 crore as compensation to family of an accident victim who died in 2011. The family had challenged an earlier order of giving them ₹1.03 crore as compensation and sought an enhancement of the amount. HC directed a tempo driver, involved in the accident, and an insurance company to pay the rest amount within a month.

130.title: Protesting farmers in H'yana file 'missing' complaint of local MP
130.article_body: Farmers, who've been holding a protest seeking compensation for their damaged crops for a month in Haryana's Hisar, have filed a "missing" complaint of the local BJP MP Brijendra Singh with police. A Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leader claimed that "the public is searching for Singh as development projects are halted". A police spokesperson confirmed that the complaint was filed.

131.title: There's something that RR have seen in Parag, which we haven't in last 3 years: Manjrekar
131.article_body: Talking about RR's 20-year-old all-rounder Riyan Parag, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "There's something that RR have seen in him, which we haven't seen in last three years." Manjrekar stated, "In his two full IPL seasons...he averaged about 11. His strike rate was around 110. They went for him in auction and bought him at a much higher price of ₹3.8 crore."

132.title: Saudi prince, a major Twitter shareholder, rejects Musk's offer; he replies
132.article_body: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud, a billionaire and one of Twitter's largest shareholders, rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter saying his offer isn't close to the company's "intrinsic value". Meanwhile, Musk replied, "Just two questions...How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly? What are the Kingdom's views on journalistic freedom of speech?"

133.title: 2 women caught while taking lift from contractor they earlier robbed in G'gram
133.article_body: Two women were arrested in Gurugram after they took a lift from a contractor, four months after they robbed him of ₹3.5 lakh using the same modus operandi. Last year, they had taken lift from the contractor and stole ₹3.5 lakh kept in a bag. On Wednesday, the contractor traced them asking for a lift on the same route.

134.title: Pope Francis visits Italian prison for foot-washing ritual
134.article_body: Pope Francis visited an Italian prison and washed and kissed the feet of 12 inmates in a Holy Thursday ritual that symbolizes humility and service. The 12 inmates included men and women of various ages and different nationalities, the Vatican said. In the past two years, scaled-down versions of the service were held inside the Vatican because of COVID-19 curbs.

135.title: Tribal Odisha woman slits 3-yr-old son's throat in intoxicated state; arrested
135.article_body: A tribal woman from Odisha's Koraput district has been arrested after she, in an intoxicated state, slit the throat of her three-year-old son. Police claimed the accused had a raucous celebration of the Chaiti festival with her husband and neighbours with heavy drinking and feasts. The next day, she came to her senses and started repenting her crime, police added.

136.title: Curfew relaxed in riot-hit Khargone in MP; only women allowed to step out
136.article_body: Curfew was relaxed for two hours on Thursday in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, where communal clashes broke out during Ram Navami celebrations. According to Khargone Collector Anugrah P, only women were allowed to step out of their homes and buy essential commodities during the two-hour relaxation provided from 10 am. Only milk, vegetable, medical and provision stores were opened.

137.title: Punjab govt must release ₹800 cr dues of sugarcane farmers: Partap Bajwa
137.article_body: Punjab government must release nearly ₹800 crore worth of dues to sugarcane farmers, Leader of Opposition in Vidhan Sabha Partap Singh Bajwa said. "On March 22, I had written to the CM...Till date, I have received no response of the same," the Congress leader added. "This situation is untenable...sugarcane farmers of Punjab have not been paid since February," Bajwa added.

138.title: India has to grow big, those blocking way will be eliminated: RSS chief
138.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Haridwar, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that India has to grow big and its rise is incumbent upon the rise of 'dharma'. Comparing India's progress to that of a vehicle that only has an accelerator and no brakes, Bhagwat said that those trying to stop it "will either step aside or be eliminated".

139.title: She has made the right choice: Alia's brother Rahul on her wedding with Ranbir
139.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt has said her actor husband Ranbir Kapoor is a nice guy and will take care of her. "He'll love her and respect her well. He's a cultured man. I wish him well," he added. "Alia's choice of films are good and she has also made the right choice in her life partner," said Rahul.

140.title: Will be interesting to see how Musk's Twitter offer evolves: Amazon CEO
140.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in an interview discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy Twitter said the news is "very interesting", adding, "We all use Twitter...to some degree...It'll be interesting to see how it evolves." On being asked if Musk is ultimately going to buy Twitter, Jassy said, "I don't know. That's, that's the rumour."

141.title: President Biden will not visit Ukraine: White House
141.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said US President Joe Biden will not visit Ukraine amid the ongoing war. Talking to reporters on Thursday, Biden said he's considering sending a senior US official to Ukraine. Several European leaders, including UK PM Boris Johnson, have visited Ukraine and met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in recent days in show of support for Kyiv.

142.title: In my era, people slapped DCs to get noticed as politicians: BJP MP
142.article_body: BJP MP Janardan Mishra has claimed that during his era, people used to "slap District Collectors (DCs) or commissioners to get noticed as politicians". Mishra made the remarks while addressing a BJP workers' gathering in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. "We were aware that slapping senior officials will establish us as political leaders at least for...next one or two years," Mishra added.

143.title: Upset over not being served breakfast, Thane man fires at daughter-in-law
143.article_body: A 76-year-old man allegedly opened fire at his 42-year-old daughter-in-law in Thane after reportedly being annoyed over not being served breakfast along with tea. Police said that the woman suffered bullet injuries in her abdomen and is undergoing treatment. An offence under IPC sections 307 [attempt to murder] and 506 [criminal intimidation] has been registered against accused.

144.title: Man booked 35 years ago in infant murder case acquitted in Mumbai
144.article_body: A Mumbai court acquitted a 68-year-old man, identified as Ramchandra Sharma who was booked 35 years ago, from charges of kidnapping and killing an infant. Sharma was granted bail following his arrest earlier but a non-bailable warrant was issued against him after he was declared absconding. Sharma was booked on suspicion of killing a baby born to his wife.

145.title: Video from Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor's varmala ceremony goes viral
145.article_body: A video from Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's varmala ceremony from their wedding has gone viral on social media. In the video, Ranbir can be seen kneeling down during the ceremony after initially sitting atop the shoulders of his friends. Alia and Ranbir got married in an intimate wedding ceremony on Thursday.

146.title: Take adequate cyber security measures: Hyd Police Commissioner urges banks
146.article_body: In a meeting of representatives from 51 urban cooperative banks on Thursday, Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand discussed the growing instances of cybercrime. The commissioner explained threats from hackers and urged banks to strengthen their cyber security apparatus. The meeting was convened by RBI in view of the recent Mahesh Bank fraud case involving illegal transfer of ₹12.48 crore.

147.title: What did Elon Musk say when asked why he wanted to acquire Twitter?
147.article_body: Speaking at a TED event, the world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while answering a query on why he wanted to acquire Twitter said it was important for "there to be an arena for free speech". Musk added, "This isn't a way to sort of make money...Having a public platform that is maximally trusted and broadly inclusive, is...important."

148.title: Naga Chaitanya fined ₹700 in Hyd for using tinted glass on his car
148.article_body: Naga Chaitanya on Tuesday had to pay a challan of ₹700 in Hyderabad for using tinted windows on his car. As per reports, the actor was travelling in a Toyota Vellfire when the Jubilee Hills traffic police stopped him. Recently, 'Pushpa' star Allu Arjun was also fined for using tinted windows on his Range Rover in Hyderabad.

149.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor took 4 pheras at their wedding: Alia's brother Rahul Bhatt
149.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt has revealed that Alia and Ranbir Kapoor took four pheras instead of seven pheras at their wedding. "They had a special pandit...The pandit has been with the Kapoors for many years now," he added. "He explained the significance of each phera...it was really fascinating. We have not been exposed to this," he stated.

150.title: Shane Watson ranks the 'big five' Test batters in order
150.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has ranked the 'big five' Test batters in order. Calling him 'superhuman', Watson ranked Virat Kohli as the number one Test batter. Watson chose Babar Azam as the number two batter, followed by Steve Smith, Kane Williamson and Joe Root. "Smith has just started to come off a little bit," Watson said.

151.title: I used to be frustrated during my TV days as women took up all roles: Vivek
151.article_body: Actor Vivek Mushran said that he used to be frustrated when he worked in the television industry as "women would take up all the roles". "When OTT happened I thought at least men will also get some space, but here too women are ruling the scene...But it feels good...as women are getting to do so much more here," he added.

152.title: Earthquake of magnitude 5.3 hits Arunachal Pradesh
152.article_body: According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), an earthquake measuring 5.3 magnitude on the Richter scale hit north of Pangin in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday at 6.56 am. "Earthquake of Magnitude 5.3, Occurred on 15-04-2022, 06:56:19 IST, Lat: 38.62 and Long: 97.05, Depth: 30 Km, Location: 1176km N of Pangin, Arunachal Pradesh," NCS tweeted.

153.title: Germany seizes world's largest superyacht 'Dilbar' owned by Russian oligarch
153.article_body: The world's largest superyacht, 'Dilbar', owned by Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov, has been officially seized by Germany as part of its sanctions against Moscow over the invasion of Ukraine. With two helipads and the largest indoor pool ever installed on a yacht, 'Dilbar' is worth $600 million and it costs $60 million per year to maintain it.

154.title: 25-yr-old man kills self 3 days after wife dies by suicide in Pune
154.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Pune, three days after his wife also took the extreme step. The man reportedly could not bear his wife's loss. According to the police, the man committed the act in the bathroom under the pretext of taking bath after attending his wife's funeral. The wife had apparently died by suicide on Sunday.

155.title: Chhattisgarh CM seeks GST compensation for 10 more years, writes to PM
155.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel urged PM Narendra Modi to continue the present compensation grant system of Goods and Services Tax (GST) for another ten years as its discontinuation will bring huge economic loss to the producing state. If it is not continued beyond June 2022, then Chhattisgarh is likely to face a revenue loss of nearly ₹5,000 crore, he said.

156.title: Raj Thackeray is BJP's loudspeaker, people will shut it down: Sanjay Raut
156.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that MNS chief Raj Thackeray has become BJP's loudspeaker. "This loudspeaker is blaring out of desperation but people will shut it down," Raut added. Raj Thackeray had warned that MNS workers will install speakers outside mosques and play Hanuman Chalisa if loudspeakers from mosques are not removed till May 3.

157.title: Ravi Kishan, Manoj Tiwari to play Kewat, Parashurama in Ayodhya Ram Leela
157.article_body: BJP leaders Ravi Kishan and Manoj Tiwari will be playing the roles of 'Kewat' and 'Parashurama' respectively in Ram Leela that will be held in Ayodhya, Mahant Maithili Ramansharan Maharaj of Shri Lakshman Kila said. Reports said that last year, actress Bhagyashree and actor Rahul Bhuchar played the roles of Goddess Sita and Lord Ram respectively.

158.title: Amazon not close to accepting crypto, don't have Bitcoin myself: CEO
158.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in an interview with CNBC said the e-commerce firm is not close to adding cryptocurrency as a payment option to its retail business. "I don't have Bitcoin myself," Jassy said. However, he said it might be possible for Amazon to sell NFTs and that he expects NFTs to continue to grow "significantly".

159.title: Stones pelted at Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao's house in Hyderabad
159.article_body: Unidentified persons pelted stones at senior Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao's house in Hyderabad's Amberpet, police said. A car parked in front of the house was also damaged in the incident. Rao, while condemning the attack, criticised the state government for failing to ensure his security. He claimed he had approached Telangana DGP after receiving threat calls in the past.

160.title: Former Gujarat Congress MLA Pravin Maru joins BJP
160.article_body: Former Congress MLA from Gujarat's Gadhada constituency Pravin Maru on Thursday joined BJP at the party's state headquarters in Gandhinagar. Maru had resigned as Congress MLA in March 2020. "I had been with the Congress party for 30 years, but it failed to form a government," Maru said. "Whichever responsibility BJP gives me, I will accept it," he further said.

161.title: Elephant tramples elderly couple to death in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh
161.article_body: An elderly couple was killed on Thursday after being trampled on by an elephant in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh. According to Forest Range Officer Annand Kumar Singh, the elephant attacked 65-year-old Vedlal Pandit and his 60-year-old wife Shanti Devi when they were working in a field. While Vedlal died on the spot, Shanti succumbed to her injuries on the way to hospital.

162.title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal rejects Musk's Twitter takeover bid
162.article_body: Saudi Arabian investor Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, one of the major shareholders in Twitter, has rejected a takeover bid by billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk. "I don't believe that the proposed offer by Elon Musk ($54.20 per share) comes close to the intrinsic value of Twitter given its growth prospects," he said. Musk has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion.

163.title: 62-yr-old man jailed without bail for shooting 10 at New York subway
163.article_body: A 62-year-old man accused of shooting 10 commuters at a Brooklyn subway station was jailed on Thursday without bail after prosecutors argued he posed a "serious and ongoing danger to the community". Frank James is charged with a federal terrorism offence that applies to attacks on mass transit systems. Assistant US Attorney Sara Winik said the attack was "premeditated".

164.title: 3 soldiers lose lives as vehicle overturns on way to encounter site in J&K
164.article_body: At least three soldiers lost their lives and five were injured after their vehicle overturned while en route to an encounter site in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Thursday, PRO (Defence) Srinagar said. The driver seemingly lost control due to wet road conditions, it added. It also clarified that the reports of the accident being caused by stone-pelting were false.

165.title: 4 LeT militants linked to 6 terror crimes killed in encounter in J&K
165.article_body: Four Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists who were linked to six terror crimes, including attacks on non-resident labourers, were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Thursday, IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said. Police had launched a search operation in the area based on specific information. "The hiding terrorists fired indiscriminately upon the search party," a police spokesperson said.

166.title: Major tech firms calling lawyers asking if they can buy Twitter: Cuban
166.article_body: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter for $43 billion, US billionaire investor Mark Cuban took to Twitter. Cuban tweeted, "Every major tech company, Google, FB, et al is on the phone with their antitrust lawyers asking if they can buy Twitter...Twitter is on the phone with their lawyers asking which can be their white knight."

167.title: Yuvraj praises Buttler for sportsmanship, fans accuse him of taking 'cheap shot' at Ashwin
167.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to praise RR's Jos Buttler for his sportsmanship during RR's match against GT. In his tweet, Yuvraj wrote, "Other players should learn from him...specially teammates!" Fans accused Yuvraj of taking "cheap shot" at Ravichandran Ashwin. "What is this obsession with Ashwin," a fan wrote. "You could've appreciated Buttler without targeting Ashwin," wrote another.

168.title: Woman who was caught after she jumped off Delhi metro station building dies
168.article_body: A woman who jumped off Akshardham Metro Station building in Delhi on Thursday died during treatment at a hospital. The woman was caught by the security staff, however she sustained serious injuries. "She was a resident of Hoshiarpur in Punjab, worked in Gurugram, and had quit her job recently," DCP Metro Jitendra Mani said.

169.title: Delhi govt passes budget of ₹476.89 cr for development of mandis
169.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday passed a budget of ₹476.89 crore for the development of mandis in the city for the financial year 2022-23. Delhi Development Minister Gopal Rai said that CCTVs will be installed in all the mandis and renovation of Azadpur Mandi's Kisan Bhawan will be carried out. Notably, the government has allocated ₹178.73 crore to APMC Azadpur.

170.title: Over 1,000 houses damaged in a cyclonic storm in Meghalaya; 47 villages affected
170.article_body: Over 1,000 houses in Meghalaya's Ri Bhoi district were damaged in a cyclonic storm that hit the district on Thursday, a senior district official said. "Prima facie, 47 villages in the district were affected in the storm," he added. "One temporary shelter has been set up in Syadheh village as standby," said Ri Bhoi Deputy Commissioner (DC) Arpit Upadhyaya.

171.title: Babasaheb rose above discrimination and laid down the Constitution: CM Yogi
171.article_body: Speaking at an event organised to mark Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar's 131st birth anniversary, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that Ambedkar was a person who rose above "discrimination". "Think of the times and social conditions that existed 131 years ago. But Babasaheb...laid down the Constitution...without ever hinting at the prejudice and inequality he faced," CM Yogi Adityanath said.

172.title: Member of ISIS' 'Beatles' cell convicted in US for beheading hostages
172.article_body: A US jury has convicted a 33-year-old ex-British citizen for his role in the ISIS hostage-taking scheme that led to the beheading of Americans in Syria and Iraq. El Shafee Elsheikh, a member of ISIS cell dubbed "the Beatles", was found guilty on eight counts, including kidnapping and murder. Elsheikh is the highest-profile ISIS fighter to stand trial in US.

173.title: India reports 949 new COVID-19 cases, active cases in country at 11,191
173.article_body: India has reported 949 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,191, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,743. The country saw 810 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

174.title: Indian documentary 'All That Breathes' to screen at Cannes Film Festival
174.article_body: India's 'All That Breathes', a documentary by Delhi-based filmmaker Shaunak Sen, will premiere in the Special Screening segment at the upcoming Cannes Film Festival, the organisers announced on Thursday. The 90-minute documentary follows the journey of two brothers, Mohammad and Nadeem, who work with injured birds, especially the black kites. The film festival will be held from May 17-28.

175.title: Passenger's phone catches fire mid-air on IndiGo flight, no injuries caused
175.article_body: A passenger's mobile phone caught fire mid-air on IndiGo's Dibrugarh-Delhi flight on Thursday and the cabin crew was able to douse it with a fire extinguisher.
