As per the DGCA officials, there was no injury caused to any passenger or cabin crew member due to it. A crew member had first spotted sparks and smoke emitting from the passenger's phone.

176.title: Bombay gymkhana ran eating house without health licence for 2 years, RTI reveals
176.article_body: Bombay Gymkhana, one of the oldest clubs in Mumbai, was running its eating house without a mandatory health licence for two years, an RTI filed by activist Sanjay Gurav revealed. The one-year health licence of the eating house expired on December 23, 2019, and since then it has been operating without permission, an inspection conducted by BMC officials revealed.

177.title: I'd watch KBC, dream of working with him: Aakanksha on 'Runway..' co-star Big B
177.article_body: Actress Aakanksha Singh who will be sharing screen space with actor Amitabh Bachchan in 'Runway 34', said that she used to dream about working with him when she used to watch the show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati'. "Being with him on sets...seeing him perform...is a great learning experience. He is an...institution in himself and is an inspiration for me," she added.

178.title: Bhagwant Mann’s character is purer than 24 karat gold: Raghav Chadha
178.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party national spokesperson Raghav Chadha said that the character of Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is "purer than 24 karat gold". His comments came after SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal accused Maan visiting Takht Damdama Sahib while being drunk. Sukhbir also said that Mann had visited the holy place in a drunken state even earlier.

179.title: 24-yr-old man gets 10-yr jail for carrying 250 gm charas in Chandigarh
179.article_body: A local court in Chandigarh sentenced a 24-year-old man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for carrying 250 grams of charas in 2019. The convict, Sajan, was caught by the police after they spotted him trying to evade detection at a check post in May 2019. Upon checking, they had recovered the drug from a polybag that he was carrying.

180.title: Punjab man stalks & assaults woman, steals her undergarments; booked
180.article_body: A 58-year-old man in Punjab's Machipur has been booked for allegedly assaulting a 47-year-old woman since 2005. The woman claimed that the accused trespassed into her house and stole her undergarments. He also urinated in front of her, making obscene gestures in public, she claimed. She alleged he assaulted her and tore her shirt at a school where she works.

181.title: Apple testing 9 new Macs with 4 different M2 chip variants: Report
181.article_body: Apple has started testing several new Mac models with the next-generation M2 chips, Bloomberg News reported citing sources. It's testing at least nine Mac models with four different M2-based chips with third-party apps in its App store. It's also testing a Mac mini with an M1 Pro chip, the same processor used in the entry-level 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pros.

182.title: Heavy rain causes waterlogging in B'luru; 1 electrocuted to death
182.article_body: A 21-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Bengaluru as heavy rainfall caused waterlogging in the city on Thursday. The man was reportedly electrocuted when he came in close contact with a cut wire, however, BESCOM claimed they'd cut the power in the area. The BBMP also said that about 12 trees had been uprooted due to the wind speed.

183.title: Auto driver booked for pelting stones at BEST bus driver in Mumbai
183.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked by police for injuring a BEST bus driver by throwing stones at him in Mumbai. According to police, the incident occurred on Wednesday night when BEST bus driver, Kailash Daatkhile, had to apply emergency brakes after an auto stopped suddenly. Daatkhile allegedly shouted at the auto driver who then pelted stones in retaliation.

184.title: Upgraded AC local trains to be introduced by 2023 in Mumbai: Report
184.article_body: The new AC local trains with upgraded seating arrangements and increased space are expected to be introduced on Mumbai's railway tracks by 2023, reported HT. The trains will have metro-like interiors with longitude seatings and additional space for passengers to travel inside the train, the report said. The upgraded AC locals will have separate luggage compartments, the report added.

185.title: 75-year-old man stabbed to death at his home in Gurugram's Sector 69
185.article_body: A 75-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death at his four-storey residence in Gurugram's Sector 69 on Wednesday, police said. The deceased was stabbed at least six times in the neck with a sharp weapon used for breaking ice slabs, police added. The suspects allegedly rang the doorbell of the deceased's flat after climbing to the third floor, police stated.

186.title: Thieves bought second-hand car, cleared debts with loot from Sonam's house
186.article_body: The nurse and her husband, who were arrested for a theft of cash and jewellery worth ₹2.4 crore from the residence of Sonam Kapoor's in-laws, used the money to pay off their debt, cover their parents' treatment costs and bought a second-hand car. The police said the nurse would steal valuables from the room after giving sedatives to Sonam's mother-in-law.

187.title: Sex racket busted at Pune spa; 6 including 4 women from Thailand rescued
187.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a sex racket operating from a spa centre in Aundh and has rescued six women, including four from Thailand. The manager of the spa has been arrested, police said, adding that two other persons have been booked for allegedly running the sex racket. "Visa details of the four women are being probed," an officer said.

188.title: 4 including 2 women held for running prostitution racket in Navi Mumbai
188.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including two women, for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Navi Mumbai's Vashi area. According to police, the accused used to lure customers over the phone and meet them at designated places. Vashi police then laid a trap by sending dummy customers and caught the accused near a lodge in Juhu Gaon.

189.title: 55 homes of man who says Putin is godfather to his daughter seized by Ukraine
189.article_body: Ukrainian authorities on Thursday said they have seized 154 assets belonging to pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk. The assets include 23 houses, 32 apartments, 30 plots of land, 26 cars, and one yacht, The Washington Post reported. Medvedchuk, who says Russian President Vladimir Putin is godfather to his daughter, was arrested earlier this week.

190.title: Jonty Rhodes touches Sachin Tendulkar's feet after IPL match, video goes viral
190.article_body: A video went viral on social media showing Punjab Kings (PBKS) assistant coach Jonty Rhodes touching Mumbai Indians (MI) mentor Sachin Tendulkar's feet following the IPL 2022 match between MI and PBKS. Sachin was seen trying to stop Rhodes from touching his feet while the teams were greeting each other. "Watch IPL just for moments like these," a fan tweeted.

191.title: Those b*******: Musk on SEC over his 2018 Tesla tweets settlement
191.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while discussing his SEC settlement over his 2018 Tesla tweets said, "I was forced to concede to the SEC unlawfully. Those b*******." He added he was forced to settle as banks threatened to cease providing capital and Tesla could have gone bankrupt. "I was forced to admit that I lied to save Tesla's life," Musk said.

192.title: 14-yr-old boy rapes 13-yr-old girl, threatens with scissors in Pune
192.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been booked for allegedly threatening a 13-year-old girl with scissors and then raping her in Pune. The incident had occurred on April 3 when the accused forcibly entered the house while the girl was alone, the girl's father claimed in the complaint. The accused had reportedly also threatened to kill the girl's parents.

193.title: Hardik Pandya apologises to Prasidh Krishna after edging ball to four, video goes viral
193.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya was seen apologising to Rajasthan Royals (RR) fast bowler Prasidh Krishna after scoring a boundary through a thick outside edge on the last delivery of their innings. Prasidh was seen smiling after Hardik apologised. Hardik scored 87*(52) as his team defeated RR by 37 runs.

194.title: Not sure if I'll be able to acquire Twitter, have a Plan B too: Musk
194.article_body: After making an offer to acquire Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he wasn’t sure if he'll be "actually able to acquire it." Speaking at a TED event, Musk also said he has a Plan B if Twitter rejected his offer. He said his offer was to create "an inclusive arena for free speech" and not to make money.

195.title: 1 dead, 5 injured in AC compressor explosion in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
195.article_body: A man died and five others were injured after an air-conditioner compressor exploded which led to a fire at an eatery in Delhi's Jamia Nagar on Thursday, police said. Earlier, officials said 13 people were injured following a cylinder blast, however, police later confirmed it was an AC compressor explosion. The fire was extinguished within an hour, an official added.

196.title: Russian warship sinks after being hit by Ukrainian missile
196.article_body: Russia has said its warship Moskva sank on Thursday after an explosion and fire that Ukraine claimed was caused by a missile strike. The warship sank as it was being towed to port in stormy weather, Russian news agencies quoted the defence ministry as saying. Ukraine said it hit the warship with a Ukrainian-made Neptune anti-ship missile.

197.title: Mumbai man complains about people playing cricket till 2:30 am, police respond
197.article_body: A Twitter user, while tagging Mumbai police in his tweet, complained of disturbance being caused due to people playing cricket at night. "Night cricket...has become nuisance...Is it legal? They play till 2.30 am...and [are] very noisy...It disturbs our sleep...not to mention we have senior citizens in building," he wrote. Mumbai police said they have informed main control room about issue.

198.title: Mumbai man kills 17-year-old female friend in hotel, later dies by suicide
198.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly killed his 17-year-old female friend in a hotel and then killed himself by jumping in front of a running train in Mumbai. Police said the duo was in a relationship and the girl had sent some intimate pictures of herself to him. The man allegedly demanded money from her and threatened to post her pictures online.

199.title: Twitter not held hostage by Musk's offer, CEO Parag tells staff: Report
199.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, while reassuring the staff, said that they weren't being "held hostage" by the news of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy the company, a source told Reuters. Agrawal also encouraged employees to remain focused and said that "we as employees control what happens". On Thursday, Musk offered to acquire Twitter for $43 billion.

200.title: Jumped in river but couldn't find them: Uncle of boys who drowned in Delhi
200.article_body: Omar Shahid, uncle of Sahil and Mohd Ali who along with their two friends drowned in the Yamuna while playing in Delhi's Kalindi Kunj area, said he found the boys' clothes on the riverbank. "I jumped into the river but couldn't find them...I got scared and called police," Shahid said. Police said three out of four bodies have been recovered.

201.title: GT defeat RR to jump to top of points table, record their highest total in IPL 2022
201.article_body: GT defeated RR by 37 runs to register their fourth win and jump to the top of IPL 2022 points table. GT put up a total of 192/4, their highest total in IPL 2022 so far. GT captain Hardik Pandya top-scored with 87*(52). GT pacers Lockie Ferguson and Yash Dayal took three wickets each as RR were restricted to 155/9.

202.title: COVID-19 cases, deaths drop for 3rd straight week: WHO
202.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said global COVID-19 cases and deaths dropped for a third consecutive week. WHO said between April 4 to 10 over seven million cases and over 22,000 deaths were reported across the six WHO regions, representing a 24% drop in cases and 18% drop in deaths compared to the previous week.

203.title: We know that the season has only just begun: Ferrari President Elkann
203.article_body: Ferrari President John Elkann said Ferrari understands that "the season has only just begun" after winning two out of the three races so far this season. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won in Bahrain and Australia while finishing second in Saudi Arabia. "Like all our fans around the world, I am happy to be back competing at the highest level," Elkann said.

204.title: Russia trying to recruit our citizens to fight in Ukraine: Moldova
204.article_body: Moldova on Thursday accused Russia of trying to recruit its citizens from the country's breakaway region of Transdniestria to fight in Ukraine. This comes days after British military intelligence made similar claims, adding that Russia wants to boost its troop buildup in Ukraine. Located in eastern Moldova, Transdniestria is a narrow strip of land controlled by pro-Russian separatists.

205.title: India's Pujara, Pakistan's Rizwan make their Sussex debut together, club shares pic
205.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara and Pakistani wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan made their debut for county cricket club Sussex today. Sussex took to Twitter to share a picture of Pujara and Rizwan posing together wearing their debut caps ahead of their match against Derbyshire. "What an amazing picture," a fan commented on the picture.

206.title: Have gained a wonderful son: Alia's mother Soni Razdan on Ranbir
206.article_body: After Alia Bhatt tied the knot with Ranbir Kapoor on Thursday, Alia's mother Soni Razdan took to Instagram and congratulated the couple. "They say you lose a daughter when you gain a son. I say we gain a wonderful son, a lovely...family," Soni captioned the post. "My darling beautiful baby girl is right here with us always," she added.

207.title: World no. 5 Tsitsipas beats Djere to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
207.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas on Thursday beat Laslo Djere 7-5, 7-6(1) to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Tsitsipas has won seven ATP Tour titles so far in his career. The 23-year-old will face Argentina's Diego Schwartzman in the quarter-finals. Tsitsipas won his maiden ATP Masters 1000 title in Monte Carlo last year.

208.title: Wind & light rainfall bring relief from heat in parts of Delhi
208.article_body: Residents got a brief relief from the scorching heat on Thursday evening as gusty winds and very light rainfall were reported in parts of Delhi-NCR. The maximum temperature was recorded at 39.4°C, three degrees above normal, at the Safdarjung weather observatory. At 8:30 pm, the temperature fell to 29.4°C. IMD predicted the temperature to reach around 42°C on April 18.

209.title: UK, EU impose further sanctions on 178 Russian separatists
209.article_body: The UK and EU on Wednesday imposed new sanctions on 178 Russian separatists over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "In the wake of the horrific rocket attacks on civilians in eastern Ukraine, we are today sanctioning those who prop up the illegal breakaway regions and are complicit in atrocities against the Ukrainian people," Britain's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

210.title: Goldsmith who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home held; ₹1cr jewellery recovered
210.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested a goldsmith who purchased the stolen jewellery belonging to actress Sonam Kapoor's mother-in-law. Police said they have recovered stolen jewellery worth more than ₹1 crore that included 100 diamonds, six gold chains, diamond bangles and a diamond bracelet. The jewellery was stolen by a caregiver employed for Sonam's mother-in-law.

211.title: 4 South Korean women killed as car crashes with truck in Australia
211.article_body: Police on Thursday said four South Korean women, all aged in their 20s, were killed when their car crashed with a truck in the state of Queensland on Wednesday evening. Assistant Police Commissioner Mike Condon said one of the women failed to give way to the truck at an intersection on the highway causing the collision.

212.title: Picture of Ranbir, Alia cutting cake at their wedding surfaces online
212.article_body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt cutting a cake at their wedding has surfaced online. This comes after Ranbir and Alia tied the knot on Thursday. In another picture, the couple could be seen drinking champagne. The duo got married after dating for five years. Karan Johar, Karisma Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor were among those who attended the wedding.

213.title: Father would be blessing PM Modi: Ex-PM's son on museum for PMs
213.article_body: Neeraj Shekhar, who is a BJP MP and son of late PM Chandra Shekhar, thanked PM Narendra Modi for the Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya, a museum dedicated to every PM of India since independence. Calling PM Modi a true statesman above party lines, Shekhar wrote, "Wherever he is, my father would be blessing PM Modi...So would all other Prime Ministers."

214.title: World no. 3 Zverev beats Delbonis to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
214.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev on Wednesday beat Federico Delbonis 6-1, 7-5 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Monte Carlo. "This is the only Masters on clay I haven't won yet, but I'm very motivated to do so," Zverev said. The 24-year-old German has won five ATP Masters 1000 titles so far.

215.title: Delhi sees 325 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs, active cases cross 900
215.article_body: Delhi on Thursday added 325 fresh COVID-19 cases to its tally while the number of active cases was recorded at 915. No coronavirus-related deaths were registered in the last 24 hours and the positivity rate stood at 2.39%. Amid a rise in cases, Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) will hold a meeting on April 20, an official confirmed today.

216.title: Congratulations to both of you, all the love & happiness: Katrina to Ranbir-Alia
216.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif on Thursday congratulated newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Congratulations to both of u (you)...All the love and happiness," Katrina commented on the couple's wedding pictures shared by Alia Bhatt on Instagram. "Today, surrounded by our family and friends, at home...we got married," Alia captioned her wedding pictures.

217.title: World no. 8 Rublev beats De Minaur to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
217.article_body: World number eight Andrey Rublev on Wednesday beat Alex de Minaur 2-6, 6-1, 6-4 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Rublev will face world number 12 Jannik Sinner for a spot in the quarter-finals. Rublev reached the final of the tournament in Monte Carlo last year where he lost to Stefanos Tsitsipas.

218.title: We must remain ever vigilant against divisiveness: CJI Ramana
218.article_body: CJI NV Ramana on Friday said one must remain ever vigilant against divisiveness and only through unity can peace and progress be achieved. While visiting Amritsar's Partition Museum, Ramana said, "This museum reminds us of our tragic past and warns us against divisions of all kinds...This dark chapter in our history should serve as a lesson to mankind."

219.title: PM realising Ambedkar's dream by ensuring equal rights for everyone: Irani
219.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Thursday said that BR Ambedkar was a great national hero, adding that PM Narendra Modi is realising his dream by ensuring equal rights for everyone. She also said that the PM has taken a pledge for the betterment of society by rising above the politics of casteism and regionalism.

220.title: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte tests positive for COVID-19
220.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte tested positive for COVID-19 over the weekend. However, the Italian is expected to be symptom-free and available to take charge of their next Premier League match against Brighton and Hove Albion on Saturday. Tottenham beat Aston Villa 4-0 in their last game leaving them in fourth place on the Premier League table with 57 points.

221.title: Pakistan Army Chief Qamar Javed Bajwa to retire in November
221.article_body: Pakistan's Chief of Army Staff General Qamar Javed Bajwa won't seek a term extension and will retire in November this year, the country's military media wing confirmed on Thursday. The announcement comes days after reports claimed that ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan had tried to dismiss Bajwa, a claim Khan has denied. Bajwa has served as Pakistan's Army Chief since 2016.

222.title: Viral video shows Ranbir carrying Alia in his arms as they pose for the media
222.article_body: A viral video shows actor Ranbir Kapoor carrying actress Alia Bhatt in his arms as they posed for the media following their wedding ceremony on Thursday. The photographers can be heard cheering for the couple in the video. The couple wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for the wedding ceremony.

223.title: I don't want to praise myself too much but I can be the best finisher for India: Parag
223.article_body: Talking about his aspirations, RR's 20-year-old all-rounder Riyan Parag said, "I don't want to praise myself too much, but I think I can be the best finisher not just for Rajasthan Royals but for India in years to come." He added, "I have got the skill-set, I've got all-rounder abilities and not just batting, fielding and bowling as well."

224.title: On the right side of history: China on its Russia stand after US' criticism
224.article_body: After US warning that China's unwillingness to sanction Russia amid war could affect its relations with other economies, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said, "China is playing a constructive role in the Ukraine issue." "We oppose unfounded accusations and suspicions against China...Time will tell that China's claims are on the right side of history," Zhao added.

225.title: Bank of India files for insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
225.article_body: Bank of India on Thursday filed a petition with the National Company Law Tribunal to initiate insolvency proceedings against Future Retail for non-payment of dues. This comes amid an ongoing legal battle between Future Retail and Amazon over the former's ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance Industries. "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us," Future Retail had said earlier.

226.title: Ukraine-returned medical students to protest in Delhi on Sunday
226.article_body: Medical students who were forced to return to Punjab from Ukraine and their parents will join a pan-India protest at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi on April 17. The protest will be staged to urge the Central government for making arrangements for students to help them complete their studies in state universities in the country.

227.title: Ashamed: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Mamata's Nadia rape case remark
227.article_body: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Wednesday reacted to Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's comment on alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia, stating that she's "ashamed". Paul claimed that case was handed over to CBI as Calcutta HC doesn't trust Bengal's administration. Mamata had remarked that the rape victim could have had an affair with accused or been pregnant.

228.title: Have always been selective about projects that I take on: Kareena
228.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that she has always been selective about the projects she works on. "If I genuinely find a script interesting, I am immediately on board," she stated. "For me, the right project is always about the story and character and also the people who will be with me on the journey of that project," Kareena added.

229.title: WhatsApp announces new 'Communities' feature to connect multiple groups
229.article_body: WhatsApp on Thursday announced a new 'Communities' feature that will enable users to bring together separate groups under one umbrella with a structure that works for them. "People can receive updates sent to the entire Community and easily organise smaller discussion groups on what matters to them," said WhatsApp. "Communities will also contain powerful new tools for admins," added WhatsApp.

230.title: Viral video shows Ranbir carrying Alia in his arms as they pose for the media
230.article_body: A viral video shows actor Ranbir Kapoor carrying actress Alia Bhatt in his arms as they posed for the media following their wedding ceremony on Thursday. The photographers can be heard cheering for the couple in the video. The couple wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for the wedding ceremony.

231.title: PM's portrait removed from govt office in Tamil Nadu, video surfaces
231.article_body: A controversy erupted after a video purportedly showed PM Narendra Modi's portrait being removed from Veppathur Town Panchayat's office in Thanjavur district in Tamil Nadu. The panchayat chairman allegedly removed the portrait at her husband's instructions. Subsequently, BJP workers in Kumbakonam lodged a complaint. The video was shared by several BJP leaders, including Tejasvi Surya.

232.title: Punjab govt won't purchase new vehicles for Ministers: CM Mann
232.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday ruled out any possibility of the state government purchasing any new vehicles for Ministers. Previously, Mann defended the "remote control" allegation by the Opposition and said that the senior officials of the state government had gone to Delhi for training purposes on his orders.

233.title: Our doors are open for Cong's Hardik Patel: AAP Gujarat chief
233.article_body: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia said his party's doors are open to welcome Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel. "We will definitely welcome such a revolutionary youth leader of Gujarat. We have seen his acceptability and liking," Italia said. Patel had said his position in Congress was "like a newly wedded groom who has been made to undergo a vasectomy".

234.title: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor get married, share pics
234.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt got married on Thursday in an intimate wedding ceremony. Alia shared pictures and wrote, "Surrounded by our family and friends, at home...in our favourite spot - the balcony we've spent...last 5 years of our relationship - we got married." "With so much already behind us, we can't wait to build more memories together," she added.

235.title: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor make 1st public appearance as a married couple
235.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, who got married on Thursday, made their first public appearance as a married couple following the wedding ceremony. They posed in front of the media for pictures. The wedding ceremony took place at the Vastu building in Mumbai and was attended by family members and close friends.

236.title: Dolphin stranded on a beach dies after beachgoers try to ride it in US; pic surfaces
236.article_body: A dolphin stranded on a beach in US' Texas died after people harassed and attempted to ride it. "If a live dolphin...strands in Texas, please DO NOT PUSH the animal back to sea, do not attempt to swim or interact with them, do not crowd them," Texas Marine Mammal Stranding Network said while sharing pictures of the incident.

237.title: Table-toppers RR to bowl first against GT, Trent Boult out due to injury
237.article_body: Table-toppers Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Gujarat Titans (GT) in their IPL 2022 match. RR fast bowler Trent Boult won't feature in today's match due to an injury. He has been replaced by Jimmy Neesham. GT have included Yash Dayal and Vijay Shankar in their playing XI.

238.title: This is not a threat: Elon Musk in his offer to buy Twitter
238.article_body: Elon Musk, in his offer to buy Twitter, said, "If the deal...doesn't work...given that I don't have confidence in management nor do I believe I can drive necessary change in public market...I'd need to reconsider my position as a shareholder." He added, "This isn't a threat, it's simply not a good investment without the changes that need to be made."

239.title: Matter of pride that most of our PMs are from humble families: PM
239.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said it's a great pride for Indians that most of our PMs belonged to humble families. "Coming from a remote countryside, from a very poor family, coming from a farmer's family, reaching the post of PM, this strengthens the faith in the great traditions of Indian democracy," he said at the inauguration of 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya'.

240.title: I once told Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion: Gadkari
240.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "I once told industrialist Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion." Gadkari said that years ago, he had approached Tata for the inauguration of a hospital named after an RSS leader. Gadkari added, "Tata asked if the hospital was only for Hindus as it belongs to RSS...I told him discrimination doesn't happen in RSS."

241.title: Sony had said 2 black actors don't sell overseas: Michael on 'Bad Boys'
241.article_body: Filmmaker Michael Bay said Sony Pictures Studios had no faith in his 1995 film 'Bad Boys' starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence. "Sony didn't believe in the movie because [they said] two black actors don't sell overseas," Michael stated. The film earned $141 million worldwide. The second and third instalments of the film were released in 2003 and 2020, respectively.

242.title: 'Jersey' release was postponed due to plagiarism case: Producer
242.article_body: 'Jersey' producer Aman Gill has said that the release of Shahid Kapoor and Mrunal Thakur-starrer film was postponed due to the plagiarism case. The case was filed by writer Rajneesh Jaiswal who claimed that the movie's story/script belonged to him. "We didn't want to go ahead and plan a release until the courts gave us a favourable order," Aman stated.

243.title: 'You're now my son-in-law,' jokes Karan Johar after Ranbir's wedding with Alia
243.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram and shared a picture with Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor from their wedding. "It's days like this that we live for...my darling Alia this is such a beautiful life step...Ranbir...you are now my son-in-law," he captioned the post. Karisma Kapoor congratulated the couple on Instagram and wrote, "Wish you both a lifetime of happiness."

244.title: If people love 'KGF 2', we could think of 'KGF 3': Director Prashanth
244.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel has said that the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2' will determine if they plan to continue the franchise. "It's too early to confirm. In cinema, you can even bring back the dead to life," Neel stated. According to the producers, Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has been released in over 10,000 screens globally.

245.title: Couldn’t have asked for a better addition to our family: Ranbir's sister on Alia
245.article_body: Following Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni congratulated the couple on Instagram. Sharing a photo of the couple from the wedding, Riddhima wrote, "Couldn't have asked for a better addition to our family! Alia, we love you." "Welcome to the family my precious girl, but you always were a part of it," she added.

246.title: Have watched you become the most loving dad: Kajal to husband Gautam
246.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, taking to Instagram, thanked her husband Gautam Kitchlu for taking care of her during pregnancy. "Thank you for being the greatest husband + to-be-dad a girl could ask for. Thank you for being so selfless," she captioned the post. "In the past 8 months, I have watched you become the most loving dad," Kajal further wrote.

247.title: Australia imposes new sanctions on 14 Russian state-owned companies
247.article_body: Australia imposed new sanctions against 14 Russian state-owned companies including defence-related entities and shipping companies. Foreign Minister Marise Payne said the new sanctions also extend to Russian Railways and Ruselectronics, an electronic company responsible for the production of about 80% of all Russian electronic components. Australia has sanctioned over 600 entities and individuals.

248.title: Putin said Austria can pay for Russian gas in euros: Chancellor
248.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin has allowed Austria to continue its payments for Russian gas imports in euros. Nehammer's comments come days after he met Putin in Moscow to discuss Russia's ongoing military offensive in Ukraine. Russia had earlier said that "unfriendly" nations will have to purchase Russian gas in roubles.

249.title: Russia loses its 40th high-ranking officer in Ukraine: Reports
249.article_body: Russia has reportedly lost its 40th high-ranking officer since its invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Lieutenant Colonel Denis Mezhuev is said to have died in battle according to reports from Russia and Ukraine. Mezhuev was the commander of the 1st Guards Motor Rifle Sevastopol Red Banner regiment. Total Russian casualties are believed to be about 20,000.

250.title: We will review 'unsolicited' offer from Elon Musk: Twitter
250.article_body: Twitter's board will review an "unsolicited, non-binding" offer from Tesla CEO Elon Musk to acquire the social media company, Twitter said on Thursday. With a stake of over 9% in Twitter, Musk has offered to buy the remaining shares at a price of $54.2/share. We will determine the course of action that's in the best interest of shareholders, Twitter added.

251.title: At least 1,000 BJP leaders in Himachal Pradesh to join AAP: Sisodia
251.article_body: At least 1,000 local BJP leaders in Himachal Pradesh will join the AAP, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said on Thursday. "Several big leaders of the BJP are also in touch with us. The BJP is completely scattered in the state now," Sisodia said. He added that the leaders feel BJP won't do anything for the state.

252.title: 'Were you sleeping?’: Owaisi to Guj govt over Ram Navami violence
252.article_body: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday criticised the Gujarat government and asked if they were "sleeping" during the violence that took place on Ram Navami. "Accept your failure. You yourself are complicit," he said, adding that more police personnel should've been deployed to bring the violence under control. "The government wanted violence," he added.

253.title: BR Ambedkar's statue found disfigured in Noida on birth anniversary
253.article_body: A statue of BR Ambedkar was found disfigured in Uttar Pradesh's Noida on his birth anniversary on Thursday, prompting police to launch a probe into the matter. The incident was reported by locals in the morning and a police spokesperson said a new statue was being installed to replace the disfigured one with the help of residents.

254.title: Amid instability in Pak, India stable due to Ambedkar's Constitution: Pawar
254.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said that despite current political instability in Pakistan and Sri Lanka, unity and stability in India have been possible due to its Constitution given by BR Ambedkar. Pawar made these remarks at an event to mark Ambedkar's 131st birth anniversary. "India is a continent-like country...Still, its stability has remained intact," he added.

255.title: Sikhs' contribution to freedom struggle can never be forgotten: Nadda
255.article_body: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Thursday said that Sikhs' contribution to the freedom struggle and protection of the nation can never be forgotten. "We are delighted that all Sikhs across the world can now connect with Harmandir Sahib, registration has now been done and it was initiated by PM Narendra Modi," he said.

256.title: I'm a big 'bhakt' of Ambedkar, want to spread his message: Kejriwal
256.article_body: On the occasion of Ambedkar Jayanti, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday that he has been a "big bhakt" of BR Ambedkar since childhood. "I have read about his life and thoughts many times. We have made education about Babasaheb compulsory in schools," he added. Kejriwal further said he wants to ensure that Ambedkar's message "reaches every household".

257.title: Death toll due to heavy rains, floods in South Africa rises over 300
257.article_body: The death toll following deadly floods due to heavy rains in the KwaZulu-Natal province in South Africa has risen to over 300. Officials on Wednesday said the death toll had reached 306. South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Wednesday pledged to help the victims. "Even though your hearts are in pain, we're here for you," he said.

258.title: Rising tax revenue keeps us on track to becoming $5 tn economy: Govt
258.article_body: The Finance Ministry on Thursday said the government's focus on capital expenditure will boost manufacturing and tax revenue collections, thereby keeping India on track to becoming a $5 trillion economy. Tax revenues in FY22 witnessed a 33.5% rise to ₹27.07 lakh crore. The Ministry added that the government has managed to keep nominal GDP growth above 10% in recent years.

259.title: 60-yr-old woman dies after being beaten by husband in Delhi
259.article_body: A 60-year-old woman died after being beaten by her unemployed husband in Delhi's Bhajanpura. According to police, the couple had gotten into a fight over financial issues last week, during which the accused beat his wife with a stick. She had received multiple injuries but refused to file a complaint, police said. She later died at a hospital during treatment.

260.title: Third Front against BJP not possible without Congress: Sharad Pawar
260.article_body: Talking about Opposition's unity for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Third Front against BJP is "not possible" without the Congress party. "Congress is still the second biggest party in the country that is why it is important to take them along," Pawar added. Opposition leaders like Mamata Banerjee have called for formation of Third Front.

261.title: Earliest evidence of Maya calendar use found inside Guatemalan pyramid
261.article_body: A glyph representing one of the Mayan calendar's 260 days, called '7 Deer', on mural fragments dating from the third century BC has been found inside the ruins of a pyramid in Guatemala. It represents the earliest-known use of the calendar. Until now, the earliest definitive Maya calendar notation dated to the first century BC.

262.title: PM Modi condoles loss of lives at chemical plant fire in Andhra Pradesh
262.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday condoled the loss of lives due to fire at a chemical factory in Andhra Pradesh. "Pained by...loss of lives due to...mishap at a chemical unit in Eluru, Andhra Pradesh. Condolences to the bereaved families. May the injured recover quickly," PMO tweeted. As many as six persons were killed and 13 injured in the fire accident.

263.title: Death toll from storm Megi in Philippines reaches 123
263.article_body: The death toll from tropical storm Megi that struck the Philippines has reached up to 123. As many as 86 people were killed and 236 injured in Baybay in Leyte province, said the government. The Philippine Army is carrying out the search and rescue operations. Over 1.62 lakh displaced people have reportedly taken shelter in the evacuation centres.

264.title: ED questions ex-Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi in illegal sand mining case
264.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday questioned former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi for over six hours in connection with an alleged illegal sand mining case, officials said on Thursday. ED recorded Channi's statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Channi's nephew Bhupinder Singh Honey was arrested by ED in the same case ahead of the 2022 Punjab Assembly elections.

265.title: Ukraine attention shows bias against black lives: WHO chief
265.article_body: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the world doesn't give equal attention to emergencies affecting black and white people. The ongoing emergencies in Ethiopia, Yemen, Afghanistan, and Syria have garnered only a "fraction" of the global concern for Ukraine, he added. "The world is not treating the human race the same way...Some are more equal than others," Tedros further said.

266.title: Imran Khan urges Pak's youth to protest against new Pak PM
266.article_body: Addressing a rally in Peshawar, Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan urged the youth of his country to protest against Pakistan's new PM Shehbaz Sharif. Khan also criticised the Sharif-led government's recent crackdown on social media and said that it's not the Pakistan of the 1970s but "Naya Pakistan", where people have the right to raise their voices through social media.

267.title: 2 men held for attacking police personnel with stones in Chandigarh
267.article_body: Two men were arrested for assaulting policemen who were trying to resolve their dispute at Sukhna Enclave in Chandigarh. The police were attacked with stones following which two police personnel were injured and taken to the hospital for treatment. "The other men who were present at the spot and attacked the policemen will also be arrested soon," said an official.

268.title: Bodybuilder Cedric McMillan, ex-Arnold Classic champion, passes away at 44
268.article_body: American bodybuilder Cedric McMillan, who had won the Arnold Classic in 2017, passed away aged 44. McMillan, a long-time veteran of the US Army and National Guard, had become a professional bodybuilder in 2009. He was unable to compete in bodybuilding competitions after 2020 due to health problems including heart issues and COVID-19.

269.title: I'll be more dangerous now: Imran Khan in 1st public address after removal as Pak PM
269.article_body: In his first public address on Wednesday at a rally in Peshawar since losing power, former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said, "I was not dangerous when I was part of the government, but I will be more dangerous now." Khan also asked the judiciary to explain the motive behind opening doors at midnight, hours before his ouster as the PM.

270.title: YouTube account tied to Brooklyn subway shooting suspect removed
270.article_body: YouTube has deleted the account that seemed to belong to the Brooklyn subway shooting suspect. He reportedly talked about violence and mass shootings in videos posted on YouTube, including one uploaded as recently as Monday. A screenshot of the suspect from one of the videos was used on an NYPD flyer seeking information about the shooting.

271.title: 2 held over threat to launch attacks over unemployment in Meghalaya: Report
271.article_body: Two people were reportedly arrested by Meghalaya Police in connection with an email sent to CM Conrad Sangma, announcing the launch of rebel group 'Lawei ba Phyrnai'. The mail threatened to attack educational institutions against rising unemployment in the state. While writing that education does not provide jobs, the sender further claimed they were too smart to be traced.

272.title: Momo sellers fight in Mumbai, seen punching and hitting each other with sticks
272.article_body: A fight erupted between two momo sellers in Mumbai's Powai, with a video of the incident going viral on social media. The incident reportedly took place around 11 pm on Monday. The video of the brawl showed people punching and hitting each other with sticks. Four people were reportedly arrested over the brawl.

273.title: Cong is 'Gangotri' of corruption: Bommai on Cong's protest over contractor's death
273.article_body: Reacting to Congress' demand to arrest KS Eshwarappa in contractor Santosh Patil's death case, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "Congress doesn't have any moral right to protest." "Congress is a Gangotri of corruption. Postmortem was done yesterday and now preliminary inquiry will come and based on that we'll proceed," he added. "Bommai wants to save his corrupt minister," Congress said.

274.title: Liquid cannabis worth ₹7.17 lakh seized in Andhra’s Chittoor, 4 arrested
274.article_body: The police in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor district seized 1.435 kg of liquid cannabis worth around ₹7.17 lakh and arrested four persons on Wednesday, police said. Two vehicles have also been seized from the accused's possession. Surveillance on ganja smuggling has been stepped up and police are on high alert to protect youth from drugs, said Anantapur range DIG Ravi Prakash.

275.title: Dharmendra Pradhan reviews welfare programmes in Odisha's Dhenkanal
275.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday reviewed several welfare programmes in Odisha's Dhenkanal. He also visited a Public Distribution System (PDS) Centre and distributed free five kg rice packets among beneficiaries. Notably, around 10 Union Ministers are visiting aspirational districts of Odisha to review the developmental projects undertaken by the central government till April 20.

276.title: There were a lot of crucial moments vs MI and we nailed them: Mayank
276.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal has said there were a lot of crucial moments during their game against MI and they nailed them to win the match by 12 runs. "When the game was 50-50, we won those moments and it came towards us...That's the brand of cricket we want to play, we want to play aggressive, hard cricket," he added.

277.title: Russian warship that was told to 'Go f**k yourself' hit by 2 Ukrainian missiles
277.article_body: A Russian warship was seriously damaged after being hit by two Ukrainian Neptune anti-ship cruise missiles. Russian news agencies said the Moskva, commissioned in 1983, was armed with 16 anti-ship Vulkan cruise missiles with a range of at least 700 km. Thirteen Ukrainian soldiers had told Moskva to "Go f**k yourself" in February.

278.title: Suryakumar made an error, he could have waited for Odean: Manjrekar
278.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said MI batter Suryakumar Yadav made a "slight error" when he decided to get a big over off PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada on Wednesday. "Suryakumar could've said, 'Rabada is difficult to get away...let it be against Odean Smith'," added Manjrekar. Rabada dismissed Suryakumar in 19th over to help his side win the game by 12 runs.

279.title: Shweta shares pics with 'living legends' Zeenat Aman and Zarina Wahab
279.article_body: Television actress Shweta Tiwari called Zeenat Aman and Zarina Wahab "living legends" as she shared a picture with them on Instagram. Alongside the picture, Shweta wrote, "Ahem...Ahem...Wear your glasses please (sunglasses emoji). Their glow will blind you! #livinglegends." Taking to the comments section, one of the users wrote, "Wow all three legends." Another user commented, "lucky you."

280.title: 5 killed, 13 injured as jeep falls into gorge in Rajasthan's Udaipur
280.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and 13 were injured as a jeep they were travelling in fell into a gorge on Udaipur-Jhadol road in Rajasthan's Udaipur. "Members of a family were returning after attending a family function at Kaliwas when they met with the accident," police said. There were three children among the deceased, police further said.

281.title: Inform district if students show any 'flu-like' symptoms: Noida official
281.article_body: With the spike in COVID-19 cases among children in Noida, the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of GB Nagar asked the education department to "immediately inform" if any flu-like symptoms are seen among students. "You are requested to immediately inform the COVID helpline 1800492211 or write to the email id cmogbnr@gmail.com...so that timely action can be taken," the CMO said.

282.title: Vice President calls for intensified efforts towards early detection of leprosy cases
282.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu called for intensified efforts for early detection of leprosy cases, equitable access to appropriate treatment and integrated leprosy services. India successfully accomplished levels of leprosy eradication defined as less than one case per ten thousand population, Naidu said. "NLEP has been at the forefront of the battle against leprosy," Naidu stated.

283.title: PM Modi inaugurates 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya' in Delhi, buys 1st ticket
283.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya', a museum in tribute to every Prime Minister since Independence, in Delhi. PM Modi bought the first ticket at the museum ahead of the inauguration. The Sangrahalaya tells the story of India after Independence through the lives and contributions of its Prime Ministers, the PMO said in a press release.

284.title: 2 killed after friend rams bike into their two-wheeler in Mumbai
284.article_body: Two men, aged 21 and 22, were killed after their bike was rammed into by another bike being driven by their friend in Mumbai's Bandra (East), police said. The friend was booked for causing the deaths due to rash and negligent driving, police added. The deceased's bike hit a divider and they fell on a car coming from opposite end.

285.title: Apple MacBook shipments delayed amid China COVID-19 lockdowns
285.article_body: Apple MacBook buyers are facing a delay in the delivery of their orders amid China's COVID-19 lockdowns. US consumers trying to order Apple's latest high-end models are now seeing delivery estimates pushed into June, Bloomberg reported. Over 30 Taiwanese companies, including Apple laptop manufacturer Quanta Computer, have halted production in China because of lockdowns.

286.title: Tamil should be the link language of India: BJP leaders in TN
286.article_body: Days after Union Minister Amit Shah said that people from different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, BJP leaders in Tamil Nadu advocated Tamil to be made the link language of India. "Tamil could qualify as the link language of India and steps should be taken in this direction," said BJP leader and former Union Minister Pon Radhakrishnan.

287.title: Oscar-winning actor Cuba Gooding Jr pleads guilty to forcibly kissing waitress at a club
287.article_body: Oscar-winning actor Cuba Gooding Jr pleaded guilty to forcibly kissing a waitress at a New York nightclub in 2018. This comes nearly three years after the actor was arrested in the case. He was accused of assaulting three different women at various night spots in 2018-2019. His guilty plea is part of an agreement that spares him immediate jail time.

288.title: CBI makes first arrest in West Bengal Congress councillor murder case
288.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday made its first arrest in connection with the murder of West Bengal Congress councillor Tapan Kandu. CBI arrested Satyaban Pramanik, an owner of a 'dhaba' who apparently had business dealings with Kandu, and a court sent him to CBI custody for four days. Notably, Kandu's brother is a suspect in the case.

289.title: Zomato delivery boy attacked, robbed of cash by 2 men in Pune
289.article_body: A Zomato delivery executive was allegedly attacked by a sharp weapon and robbed of his cash and other valuables worth ₹5,000 by two unidentified motorcycle-borne men in Pune on Tuesday. The incident happened when the 21-year-old had gone to the Balewadi area for delivery at around 2.20 am. "A probe is on to identify and arrest the robbers," police said.

290.title: As a new parent, I'll never impose my fears & desires on my child: Priyanka
290.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra, who welcomed a baby girl in January this year via surrogacy, spoke about what kind of a parent she wants to be for her daughter. She said, "As a new parent...I'll never be imposing my desires, fears, my upbringing onto my child." "There's no belief like this is my child and I'll shape everything," she added.

291.title: 13-yr-old girl dies after drowning in Sanjay Van lake in Delhi
291.article_body: A 13-year old girl reportedly died after drowning in the Sanjay Van lake in the Kishangarh area of Southwest Delhi on Wednesday. According to police, the deceased was sitting on the passageway over the lake when she suddenly slipped while playing and drowned. She was rescued and rushed to the hospital, where doctors declared her brought dead.

292.title: Brazil man, known as 'Human Satan', has his ears removed as masks no longer mandatory
292.article_body: A Brazilian body-modification addict known as 'Human Satan' has had his ears removed to celebrate the end of COVID-19 face mask rules. Michel Faro Praddo said he was just waiting for face masks to no longer be mandatory to perform the procedure. Praddo has undergone more than 60 procedures and has around 85% of his body covered in ink.

293.title: Let the rich teams stay at the bottom of IPL 2022 points table: Sehwag on MI, CSK
293.article_body: After MI suffered their fifth straight defeat, Virender Sehwag said, "Let the rich teams (MI and CSK) stay at the bottom of points table this season." Talking about MI's loss against PBKS, Sehwag stated, "It's difficult to win after two run-outs. I don't think...Suryakumar Yadav knew that the final over will be bowled by either Odean Smith or Liam Livingstone."

294.title: Ranbir is the junior version of Amitabh Bachchan: Actor's trainer
294.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor's trainer Shivoham said Ranbir is the junior version of Amitabh Bachchan when it comes to punctuality. "He has only cancelled a training session once or twice due to some work," added Shivoham. "It is amazing to see the person I am training, respects time so much," stated Shivoham. Ranbir, Amitabh will star together in the upcoming film 'Brahmastra'.

295.title: Saw videos of 700 affected families, couldn't speak: 'The Kashmir...' actor
295.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar who was recently seen in 'The Kashmir Files' said he couldn't speak a word after seeing videos showing the heart-wrenching stories of 700 families, who were victims. "We always talk about humanity and justice. Our film shows what happens when there is no humanity," added Darshan. Aamir Khan recently said every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files'.

296.title: Liverpool defeat Benfica, Man City beat Atletico to enter Champions League semis
296.article_body: Premier League sides Liverpool and Manchester City have entered the Champions League semifinals after playing out draws in their respective second legs of the quarterfinals. Manchester City, who had won the first leg 1-0, played out a goalless draw to eliminate Atletico Madrid. Liverpool, with a 3-1 win in first leg, drew 3-3 with Benfica to advance 6-4 on aggregate.

297.title: Russia says its warship in Black Sea 'badly damaged', Ukraine claims attack
297.article_body: A Russian warship in the Black Sea was "seriously damaged" as a result of the "detonation of ammunition caused by fire", Russia's Defence Ministry said. The Governor of the Odesa region in Ukraine claimed that Russia's Moskva missile cruiser was hit by two Ukrainian-made Neptune anti-ship cruise missiles. Last month, Ukraine said it had destroyed Russia's large landing ship, Orsk.

298.title: China's anti-corruption watchdog involved in Jack Ma's Ant probe: Report
298.article_body: China's anti-corruption watchdog CCDI was among the agencies involved in a recent inquiry into links between billionaire Jack Ma's Ant and state-owned Chinese companies, Bloomberg News reported. It sought to understand Ant's influence and the extent of its transactions with state banks and enterprises. It was also involved in questions sent to state firms about their exposure to Ant.

299.title: Pune man held for possessing brown sugar worth ₹28,000
299.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested by Pune City Police for possessing 5.64 grams of brown sugar worth ₹28,200. The accused, identified as Sanjay Mahadev Sathe, was arrested near the railway gate in the Wanwadi area after police found his movement suspicious. The police are now investigating to find out from where he procured the banned substance.

300.title: He doesn't praise my work easily, tells if he doesn't like it: Abhishek on Big B
300.article_body: Reacting to Amitabh Bachchan praising his performance in 'Dasvi', Abhishek Bachchan said Amitabh does not praise his work easily despite being his father, adding that he will tell if he doesn't like anything. "Earlier he...[would] worry that if he praises...people will say it's biased. But this time he said, 'You are my son...I will say what I feel'," stated Abhishek.

301.title: Ex-Army man found murdered in Bengaluru, probe underway
301.article_body: A 56-year-old ex-Army man was hammered to death at his house in Bengaluru's Goutham Colony. The deceased, Jude Suresh, was a divorcee and lived alone after the death of his mother three years ago. The house was in the name of Suresh's mother and his siblings used to come home frequently and fight over the property, the police said.

302.title: BJP govt doesn't calculate electoral benefits before public welfare: Piyush Goyal
302.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the BJP government never calculates electoral benefits before public welfare. There is an environment of "pro-incumbency" in the country, unlike during the earlier regimes, Goyal added. "Welfare of the poor is our priority…People are happy with government’s welfare work and the recent results of the Assembly elections in several states indicate that," Goyal stated.

303.title: Illegal arms supplier held at Delhi airport, was trying to flee to Dubai
303.article_body: Ghaziabad police arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly manufacturing and supplying illegal arms across western Uttar Pradesh. The accused, identified as Jahiruddin Raji, was trying to flee to Dubai and was apprehended at Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport in Delhi, police added. Raji had been in the arms manufacturing business for about a decade now, police said.

304.title: Violence during Ram Navami procession was pre-planned: Guj Police
304.article_body: Gujarat Police on Wednesday said that the violence during a Ram Navami procession in Khambhat, which left one dead, was a pre-planned conspiracy. "The Hindu community takes out processions and celebrates Ram Navami. With an aim to stop these celebrations and to increase the dominance of the Muslim community in the area, the procession was attacked," said police.

305.title: World's first-ever tweet's NFT, on sale for $48 mn, sees top bid of $280
305.article_body: An NFT of the world's first-ever tweet, being resold for $48 million, received a top bid of $280. Malaysia-based Sina Estavi purchased the NFT for $2.9 million in 2021. The auction for the NFT closed with only seven offers ranging from about $6-$280. "If I get a good offer, I might accept it, I might never sell it," Estavi said.

306.title: Complete Bharat Vandana Park work before Aug 15 next year: Delhi LG
306.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal on Wednesday reviewed the construction work of Bharat Vandana Park in Delhi's Dwarka. He also directed officials to complete the work before August 15 next year, so that it can be dedicated to the nation as part of 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. According to officials, 40% of work on Bharat Vandana Park has been completed.

307.title: How have top-ranked T20I batters performed in IPL 2022 so far?
307.article_body: World number two T20I batter Aiden Markram, who represents SRH in IPL 2022, has scored 81 runs in three innings. CSK's Devon Conway, who is ranked fifth, has played one IPL 2022 match so far, scoring just three runs. RR's Jos Buttler, who is world number 17 T20I batter, is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2022 so far.

308.title: Woman from Zimbabwe held at Ahmedabad airport with heroin worth ₹42 cr
308.article_body: A woman, in possession of 5.96 kilograms of heroin worth ₹42 crore, was arrested at Ahmedabad's  Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport. The accused, from Zimbabwe, was apprehended after she arrived from Abu Dhabi, Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officials said. "During the examination of her baggage, four plastic bags filled with brown powder substance were found," DRI stated.

309.title: 18-year-old Baby AB smashes 4 sixes in a row, video goes viral
309.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, smashed four sixes in a row against PBKS leg-spinner Rahul Chahar in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Brevis went on to smash a total of five sixes in the innings, becoming the youngest cricketer to smash five sixes in an innings in IPL.

310.title: Karnataka temple continues tradition of beginning festival with Quran recitation
310.article_body: Karnataka's Chennakeshava temple on Wednesday continued with its tradition of beginning the rathotsava (car festival) after reciting passages from the Quran. "Earlier, the temple administration issued a notice to Muslim shopkeepers urging them to close their shops. However, the government allowed them to take part...Accordingly, around 15 Muslim traders had set up their shops," an official said.

311.title: NPCI approves additional 6 crore UPI users for WhatsApp
311.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has approved an additional 6 crore users on UPI for WhatsApp. With this approval, WhatsApp will be able to expand the service to 10 crore users. The move comes months after NPCI approved increasing the user cap for WhatsApp's payment service from 2 crore to 4 crore.

312.title: 4 arrested for stealing BSNL cables in Chandigarh
312.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested four persons for stealing BSNL wires multiple times from the UT in last six months. The accused used to unfasten the coverlid of the cable duckett during the daytime. They then stole the cables after cutting them during the night. The accused used an autorickshaw to carry the tools and take back the stolen wires.

313.title: No hate speech was given at Delhi Dharam Sansad: Delhi Police to SC
313.article_body: No hate speech was given at Delhi Dharam Sansad against the Muslim community, Delhi Police told the Supreme Court. "After investigation and evaluation of the purported video clip, it was concluded that the alleged speech contained no hate speech against a particular community," police added. "All the complaints filed regarding the event are closed," Delhi Police further said.

314.title: Hundreds of earthquakes recorded near volcano that hasn't erupted for 800 yrs in Alaska
314.article_body: Hundreds of earthquakes have been reported near Mount Edgecumbe, a volcano in southeast Alaska, believed to have been dormant for at least 800 years. The cause of the quakes are not known. They may not be an indication of volcanic activity, said Dave Schneider, a research geophysicist with the US Geological Survey at the Alaska Volcano Observatory in Anchorage.

315.title: Wishing you both love, luck and light: Big B on Ranbir and Alia's wedding
315.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to Instagram on Wednesday to wish Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor as they began their pre-wedding functions. The veteran actor, who's sharing screen space with Alia and Ranbir in 'Brahmastra', shared the 'Kesariya' video from the film. He captioned it, "Wishing our Isha and Shiva...love, luck and light as they gear up to embark on a...special journey."

316.title: 2 armed men rob money exchanger of ₹60,000 at gunpoint in Ludhiana
316.article_body: Two armed robbers took away ₹60,000 cash from a money exchanger at gunpoint in Ludhiana, police said. The complainant told police that the accused entered his office while he was counting cash. One of them pointed a gun at him, and the other took out cash from the cabinet, following which they fled the scene, he added.

317.title: Huge change in approach to disaster management after 2014: Amit Shah
317.article_body: There has been a huge change in the approach to disaster management in the country after 2014, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said. His remarks came while interacting with the Jharkhand ropeway accident rescue operation personnel. "Before 2014, there was only a relief-based approach, after Modiji became PM, the approach of saving human lives came in disaster management," Shah added.

318.title: Mayank is backing me 100%: Odean on bowling final over vs MI after GT game
318.article_body: After defending 22 runs in the final over against MI, PBKS all-rounder Odean Smith said captain Mayank Agarwal's backing has been very motivating for him. Notably, Odean had failed to defend 19 runs in their game against GT. "Coach and captain...helped me mentally to be able to come into this game [against MI] and put in the performance," he stated.

319.title: COVID-19 pandemic pushed 7.7 cr people into poverty in 2021: UN
319.article_body: The United Nations in a report said that about 7.7 crore people around the world slipped into poverty in 2021 owing to the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. It said that while the rich countries managed to avoid the worst consequences, the poorer ones failed to secure early vaccine access and continue to reel under debt.

320.title: Centre should have objected to US' remark on 'rights abuses' in India: Pawar
320.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said the Centre should have raised objection to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's "we are monitoring rise in human rights abuses in India" remark. "Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and EAM S Jaishankar were present there, they should've commented," Pawar added. The statement made by the US is "detrimental" for the country, Pawar further said.

321.title: Police arrest 4 for betting on IPL matches in Bengaluru, seize ₹5 lakh
321.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have arrested four people for betting on Indian Premier League (IPL) matches in separate cases. About ₹5 lakh cash and four mobile phones have been seized from them. Three accused were arrested by the CCB in Mahalaksmi Layout Police Station limits and a fourth person was apprehended in Basavanagudi Police Station limits.

322.title: Fame Forever introduces new campaign ‘Wear it. Pair it. Anywhere it.’
322.article_body: Lifestyle's brand Fame Forever introduced the campaign 'Wear it. Pair it. Anywhere it.' The campaign seeks to highlight the idea of versatility by showcasing different style preferences fulfilling each individual's requirement. Its women's collection has denim and tops, men's wear has polos and knitted shorts, and the kids' collection has summer dresses, shorts and tees, starting from ₹249.

323.title: India reports 1,007 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death in last 24 hours
323.article_body: India has reported 1,007 new COVID-19 cases, 818 recoveries and one death in the state of Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,088 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,058, while the death toll reached 5,21,737.

324.title: Iceland Cricket name Virat Kohli as 12th man of India's best-ever Test XI, fans react
324.article_body: Iceland Cricket took to Twitter to name India's best-ever Test XI and included Virat Kohli as the 12th man. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "I think you have zero knowledge of Test cricket." Another wrote, "Do you know that India has won the most Test matches under Kohli's captaincy?" Another tweeted, "Are you kidding me?"

325.title: US approves additional $800 million military aid for Ukraine
325.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved an additional $800 million package of military assistance for Ukraine amid the Russian offensive. The package includes helicopters, artillery, armoured vehicles and protective gear for soldiers in case of a chemical or a nuclear attack. Biden said that the US anticipates a wider assault by Russia in eastern Ukraine.

326.title: Tesla racism case award to ex-US worker cut to $15 mn from $137 mn
326.article_body: A US judge has cut the award for Tesla’s racism case, involving a former Black worker Owen Diaz, to $15 million from a staggering $137 million. The judge said Tesla is liable to Diaz who said the firm ignored racial abuse at the factory where he worked. A lawyer for Diaz said he plans to appeal the lowered damages award.

327.title: Avoid travelling on Kunzum Pass highway as road not restored: Lahaul-Spiti DC
327.article_body: The deputy commissioner of Lahaul-Spiti has advised tourists and locals to avoid travelling through the Kaza-Losar-Gramphu-Koksar highway (Kunzum Pass highway) as the road has not been restored yet. He added that the work to restore the road is underway at a fast pace. Tourists and locals will be allowed to travel through the route only after its inspection, he said.

328.title: I hope Amber's corpse is decomposing in a car: Johnny Depp in text to friend
328.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp wrote in a text to his best friend he hoped Amber Heard's "corpse is decomposing in the trunk" of a car, the jury in his defamation trial against his ex-wife heard on Wednesday. Depp's friend Isaac Baruch was questioned over the messages as a witness. Depp has sued Heard over an op-ed she wrote in 2018.

329.title: At one point, we were cruising, I thought PBKS' 198 was chaseable: Rohit
329.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation ceremony after their 12-run defeat against PBKS, MI captain Rohit Sharma said they came pretty close but didn't hold their nerves to win the game. "At one time, we were cruising...and I thought 198 was chaseable...[but] a couple of run-outs didn't help our cause," he added. PBKS posted 198/5 and then restricted MI to 186/9.

330.title: Failing to give reason for son's death, Mumbai woman gets life imprisonment
330.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was given life imprisonment by a Mumbai court for killing her six-year-old son. Throughout the trial, the woman did not explain the circumstances surrounding the unnatural death of her son. The woman used to live with her son in a room shared with another woman and had allegedly killed her son when the roommate left for work.

331.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, PNG by ₹4.25 per SCM
331.article_body: Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) on Thursday hiked the Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) price in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg to ₹71.61 per kg. IGL has also increased the price of Piped Natural Gas (PNG) by ₹4.25 per standard cubic metre (SCM) to ₹45.86 per SCM. CNG price in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad has been hiked to ₹74.17 per kg.

332.title: Suryakumar might have been under pressure thinking he caused run-outs: Sehwag
332.article_body: Ex-India batter Virender Sehwag has said Suryakumar Yadav, who got out when MI needed 22 off 9 balls against PBKS, might have felt the pressure thinking about the run-outs he was involved in during their innings. "Sometimes...if you affect a runout, you go back into a shell," Sehwag added. Suryakumar was involved in run-outs of Tilak Varma and Kieron Pollard.

333.title: Engineering student stabbed to death in Meerut college; 5 detained
333.article_body: A B.Tech student of Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology (MIET) was allegedly stabbed to death by a group of students on Wednesday. According to police, it appeared to be an altercation between two groups in the college. "The rival group members stabbed Nikhil Choudhary to death," said police. Five students have been detained for questioning.

334.title: Thiruvananthapuram airport runway to be closed for 5 hours on Apr 15
334.article_body: The runway at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport will be closed from 4 pm to 9 pm on April 15 to facilitate Arattu procession of Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple. The domestic and international operations during this period have been rescheduled. The airport will also organise several competitions for passengers on April 13 and 14 as a part of the Tamil new year celebrations.

335.title: Rishi's wishes are coming true: Rakesh Roshan on Alia, Ranbir's wedding
335.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, late actor Rishi Kapoor's friend, Rakesh Roshan said, "All my blessings and good wishes are with Ranbir and Alia. Rishi's wishes are coming true." According to reports, Ranbir and Alia will tie the knot on April 14. The Haldi ceremony will reportedly begin at morning 9 am, followed by the chooda ceremony.

336.title: Mumbai woman tries to stop man who snatched her phone, falls off local train
336.article_body: A 49-year-old woman, while trying to stop a robber who stole her mobile phone, fell off a running local train in Mumbai. The incident took place at Mahim railway station. The accused  was standing on the platform and as the train started he got into the women’s compartment and snatched her phone. The victim is admitted in a government hospital.

337.title: 6 killed, 13 injured in massive fire at chemical factory in Andhra's Eluru
337.article_body: At least six people were killed and 13 got injured after a massive fire broke out at a chemical factory in Akkireddigudem in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru. "The fire broke out due to leakage of nitric acid and monomethyl," Eluru SP said. Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has announced ex-gratia of ₹25 lakh to the families of the deceased.

338.title: Man involved in 7 house break-ins held in Pune, gold ornaments recovered
338.article_body: Pune police's Crime Branch arrested a 21-year-old man in connection with at least seven house break-ins in the city. Police have recovered gold ornaments and cash worth ₹5 lakh from his possession. Police Inspector Ganesh Mane of Crime Branch said besides the accused, his maternal aunt is also involved in the thefts and a hunt is on to arrest her.

339.title: 62-year-old man arrested for shooting 10 at New York subway
339.article_body: Police in New York City have arrested a 62-year-old man suspected of shooting 10 commuters at a Brooklyn subway station. Officials said Frank James was the sole suspect in the shooting, in which 23 people were wounded. James sent off smoke grenades in a crowded subway car and then fired at least 33 shots with a handgun, police said.

340.title: Pune's SPPU signs MoU to allow students from US to study Indian culture
340.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has signed an MoU with The American Institute of Indian Studies, an international centre of Pune University, to allow students in US to study Indian culture, language and civic life. As part of the agreement, students' expenses will be borne by the institute. Further, affiliation fees, travel expenses and other facilities will also be provided.

341.title: Teacher suspended for preaching Christianity in Tamil Nadu school
341.article_body: A teacher was suspended for allegedly preaching Christianity to students in a government school in Tamil Nadu's Kanniyakumari. According to officials, the students alleged that the teacher portrayed Hinduism in a bad light. In a video, one of the students said, "She asked us to read the Bible…She said Gita is bad and the Bible is the truth."

342.title: Man accused of killing his 2 kids jumps from B'luru court building, dies
342.article_body: A murder accused has died after he allegedly jumped from the fifth floor of a civil court building in Bengaluru on Wednesday afternoon. The incident took place when the accused, Jithin Kumar, was brought to the court for a hearing. The 34-year-old was arrested in 2020 for allegedly killing his two minor children over a domestic row with his wife.

343.title: 2.6 kg opium worth ₹26 lakh seized in Hyd from ice-cream seller, held
343.article_body: Police in Hyderabad arrested an inter-state drug peddler, who used to work as an ice-cream seller, for transporting opium from Rajasthan to Hyderabad. They seized 2.6 kilograms of opium worth ₹26 lakh, ₹10,000 in cash and a mobile phone. "The accused during his visit to Rajasthan was purchasing opium from a truck driver...bringing it to the city," Rachakonda Police said.

344.title: Rohit Sharma fined ₹24 lakh, highest penalty for slow over-rate in IPL 2022 so far
344.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma has been fined ₹24 lakh after his team maintained a slow over-rate against PBKS. It's the highest fine for a slow over-rate offence in IPL 2022 so far. It was MI's second such offence of the season. Remaining members in MI's playing XI were fined ₹6 lakh or 25% of their match fee, whichever is lower.

345.title: Kieron Pollard consoles Suryakumar Yadav after getting run-out, video goes viral
345.article_body: A video of all-rounder Kieron Pollard consoling Suryakumar Yadav after getting run-out following a mix-up during Mumbai Indians' 17th over against Punjab Kings has gone viral. Pollard got run-out while running for a second after a slight misfield from Odean Smith despite initially declining Suryakumar's call for the second run. Pollard was dismissed for 10(11).

346.title: India responds after US' human rights remark, says 'We too have views about US'
346.article_body: After US said it was monitoring a "rise in human rights abuses by some Indian government, police and prison officials", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "I'd tell you that we also take our views on other people's human rights situation, including that of US. So, we take up human rights issues when they arise in this country," he added.

347.title: Russian Netflix users sue firm for leaving, demand $726,000: Report
347.article_body: Russian users of Netflix have sued the firm for leaving the Russian market, demanding $726,000 in compensation, the RIA news agency reported. "The reason for the lawsuit was a violation of Russian users' rights due to Netflix's unilateral refusal to provide services in Russia," RIA cited a law firm as saying. Netflix suspended its services in Russia in March.

348.title: Man falls off 4th floor while hanging wind chime in Gurugram, dies
348.article_body: A 79-year-old man, a retired pilot, died after allegedly falling off the balcony on the fourth floor in a residential society in Gurugram, police said. The victim was hanging a wind chime on the balcony, police added. "He had one foot on a ladder and another on the ledge and is suspected to have slipped after losing balance," police stated.

349.title: Man's shirt catches fire as birthday cake candle bursts in Mumbai, pic surfaces
349.article_body: A sparkling candle on a cake burst during a birthday celebration in Mumbai's Ambernath, injuring a man. The man was trying to blow the candle before cutting the cake, while his friends threw wheat flour and eggs on him to prank him. The candle suddenly burst and the man's shirt caught fire.

350.title: MI equal their worst start to an IPL season as PBKS hand them their 5th straight loss
350.article_body: PBKS defeated MI by 12 runs in their IPL 2022 clash in Pune. PBKS handed MI their fifth straight defeat in IPL 2022. With this, MI equalled their worst start to an IPL season. They had lost their first five matches of an IPL season in IPL 2014 as well. PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan top-scored in the match with 70(50).
