351.title: New Zealand welcomes Australian visitors after reopening border
351.article_body: New Zealand on Wednesday welcomed Australian tourists and permanent residents after opening its borders for the first time in nearly two years. "It is more than just economic for us, it's a big part of who we are to be welcoming to people," Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said. New Zealand has reported 497 COVID-19 deaths so far.

352.title: Greece to lift COVID-19 measures ahead of summer tourism season
352.article_body: Greece on Wednesday said most COVID-19 measures such as mask-wearing indoors and vaccination certificates will be lifted throughout the summer tourism season. Wearing masks indoors will no longer be required from June 1 and from May 1 to August 31 people will no longer require vaccination certificates to enter public spaces. Greece on Tuesday reported 15,000 cases and 64 deaths.

353.title: Former Italian PM Berlusconi denounces Putin over Ukraine war
353.article_body: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi denounced Russian President Vladimir Putin over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "I cannot and do not want to hide the fact that I am deeply disappointed and saddened by the behaviour of Vladimir Putin," Berlusconi said. "It [Russia] should, for its own interests, identify and put the perpetrators on trial," he added.

354.title: US city of Philadelphia to reintroduce indoor mask mandate
354.article_body: The US city of Philadelphia will reintroduce an indoor mask mandate for public spaces as COVID-19 cases rise. Philadelphia will be the first major US city to reintroduce the measure when it takes effect on April 18. "This looks like we may be at the start of a new COVID wave, like Europe just saw," Health Commissioner Cheryl Bettigole said.

355.title: 18-year-old Baby AB smashes biggest six of IPL 2022
355.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, smashed a 112-metre maximum to record the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far. He hit the six on the bowling of PBKS leg-spinner Rahul Chahar. It was the last of his four consecutive sixes during MI's ninth over. Brevis slammed a total of five sixes in his knock.

356.title: Which 7 batters have scored 10,000 runs in T20 cricket?
356.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma today became the seventh batter to reach 10,000 runs in T20 cricket. He is the second Indian after Virat Kohli to achieve the feat. Chris Gayle has scored the most runs (14,562) in T20 cricket. Gayle is followed by Shoaib Malik (11,698), Kieron Pollard (11,474), Aaron Finch (10,499), Kohli (10,379) and David Warner (10,373).

357.title: Geomagnetic storm likely to hit Earth on April 14 and 15
357.article_body: A huge amount of plasma heading towards Earth from the Sun is expected to hit the planet by Thursday. "G2 (Moderate) and G1 (Minor) geomagnetic storm watches are in effect for 14 and 15 April," tweeted Space Weather Prediction Center of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. The Sun is experiencing increase in solar activity as part of its solar cycle.

358.title: Import of cotton fully exempted from customs duties till September 30
358.article_body: The government has exempted all cotton imports from customs duties from April 14 to September 30, 2022. Currently, cotton imports attract 5% Basic Customs Duty (BCD) and 5% Agriculture Infrastructure Development Cess (AIDC). "This exemption shall benefit the textile chain - yarn, fabric, garments, and provide relief to consumers," the Finance Ministry said.

359.title: 'Dhaakad' actress Kangana reacts to being compared to Charlize Theron
359.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has reacted to American YouTuber Jaby Koay's comment on her 'Dhaakad' teaser. Jaby said Kangana's presence in 'Dhaakad' "looks stronger" than what Charlize Theron did in 'Atomic Blonde'. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kangana wrote, "Wow, thanks Jaby." In another Instagram Story, she wrote, "Today to be called better than...best action star in the world is a big compliment."

360.title: At least 45 dead as heavy floods affect Durban area in South Africa
360.article_body: Officials on Tuesday said heavy rains and flooding in the KwaZulu-Natal province of Durban in South Africa have killed at least 45 people so far. South Africa has deployed its military to Durban and the surrounding area to assist in rescue operations. "There are still cases of collapsed buildings where operations are still continuing," emergency services spokesman Robert McKenzie said.

361.title: Over 27% of German population have a migrant background: Survey
361.article_body: A new survey published by Germany's statistics agency Destatis found people with a migrant background make up over 27% of Germany's population. From around 82 million people living in the country, an estimated 22.3 million are foreign-born or people with foreign roots. Turkey is the largest point of origin with 12%, followed by Poland with 10% and Russia with 6%.

362.title: Infosys has a three-phase plan for employees to return to office: CFO
362.article_body: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy explained employees' three-phased return to work plan, saying, "In the first phase, we're encouraging people in their home locations...in the DCs (Development Centres) where they are...to come at least twice a week." He said, "Phase two is encouraging people outside DC towns to make preparations for return." He called "looking at hybrid work" the third phase.

363.title: Video appears to show Russian tanks blowing up own soldiers at point blank in Ukraine
363.article_body: A video appearing to show Russian tanks firing point blank at their own soldiers is being widely shared on social media. The video was captured by a Ukrainian surveillance drone near the village of Dmytrivka near the capital Kyiv on March 31. The incident took place just before the Russian troops started pulling out from the Ukrainian capital.

364.title: Rohit Sharma reaches 10,000-run mark in T20 cricket with a six
364.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma on Wednesday completed 10,000 runs in T20 cricket, reaching the milestone with a six on the bowling of PBKS fast bowler Kagiso Rabada. Rohit, who needed 25 runs to reach the 10,000-run mark ahead of the match, got out for 28(17). He is the second Indian batter after Virat Kohli to reach the milestone.

365.title: Whether you like it or not, farm laws will come back: BJP MP
365.article_body: BJP MP from Rajya Sabha Suresh Gopi on Wednesday claimed the three farm laws, which were repealed by the Centre, will come back. "I am a BJP man...am extremely angry over the withdrawal of the farm laws...Whether you like it or not...the farm laws will come back," he said. The government rolled back the laws after continuous protests by farmers.

366.title: Warner Bros defend cutting 'Fantastic Beasts 3' dialogue on gay romance in China
366.article_body: A six-second dialogue with a reference to a gay relationship in 'Fantastic Beasts: Secrets of Dumbledore' has been removed by Warner Bros at China's request ahead of the film's release in the country. "Warner Bros accepted those changes to comply with local requirements but the spirit of the film remains intact," the company said in a statement released to Variety.

367.title: In a league of their own: Red Bull team boss Horner on Ferrari
367.article_body: Red Bull team boss Christian Horner said Ferrari were "in a league of their own" after Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. Red Bull's Max Verstappen suffered his second retirement of the season in Melbourne. "That was a really disappointing result not to finish the race," Horner said. Leclerc leads the driver standings with 71 points.

368.title: Former world no. 3 Thiem accepts wild card for Estoril Open in Portugal
368.article_body: Former world number three Dominic Thiem has accepted a wild card for the ATP 250 event Estoril Open in Portugal. The tournament will take place from April 25 to May 1. "I've heard great things about the event and I am looking forward to coming to Portugal to play and start my comeback," Thiem said on social media.

369.title: Korda beats world no. 11 Alcaraz to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
369.article_body: Sebastian Korda on Wednesday beat world number 11 Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(2), 6-7(5), 6-3 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "It was super tough to serve today but I'm super happy with the way I handled myself," Korda said. The 21-year-old will face either Taylor Fritz or Marin Cilic in the next round.

370.title: Elderly couple reconciles by sharing sweets at UP police station
370.article_body: A 75-year-old man and his wife, who had been living separately, made peace at a police station in UP's Gonda, police said on Monday. Police called the duo to the station and helped them reach a settlement, after which they agreed to live together. A video from the incident shows the couple feeding each other sweets.

371.title: France Prez refuses to call Russian invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide'
371.article_body: France's President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday refused to term the Russian invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide', stating that he would rather be "discreet" while using such terms. "Russians and Ukrainians are fraternal peoples. What is happening is madness...I want to try...to...restore peace," he added. Macron's comments come after US President Joe Biden described the invasion as a "genocide".

372.title: 2 NCB officers, who probed Aryan Khan drugs case, suspended over 'suspicious activities'
372.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Wednesday suspended two of its officers probing the cruise ship drugs case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan. They have been suspended for allegedly indulging in 'suspicious activities', said India Today. It is not yet clear whether they have been suspended for their role in the cruise drugs case.

373.title: CBI books textiles major S Kumars in ₹1,245 crore loan fraud case
373.article_body: CBI has booked textiles major S Kumars Nationwide Limited and 14 others, including its promoters and directors, for an alleged bank fraud worth ₹1,245 crore. CBI had on Wednesday searched 13 locations related to the accused and recovered "incriminating documents", CBI spokesperson RC Joshi said. He added that promoters and directors allegedly misused bank consortium's funds between 2012 and 2018.

374.title: Andhra govt's diversion of disaster funds 'serious' matter: SC
374.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the Andhra Pradesh government's decision of diverting ₹1100 crore from the State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) to finance the state's subsidy scheme for farmers was a "serious" matter. "The money meant for disaster relief cannot be used for any other purpose," a bench of Justices MR Shah and BV Nagarathna remarked.

375.title: NCB suspends probe in-charge, intel officer in Aryan Khan drugs case
375.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has suspended the probe in-charge and intel officer probing the drugs case involving Aryan Khan for negligence, reports said. Aryan Khan was named as an accused in the case along with 19 others by the NCB. The accused persons were booked under relevant sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

376.title: Adani Green Energy becomes India's 8th most valuable company
376.article_body: Adani Green Energy has jumped two spots to become India's eighth most valued firm with a market valuation of ₹4.48 lakh crore. The company, which entered the list of top-10 valued firms on Monday, overtook Bajaj Finance and HDFC Ltd on Wednesday. Reliance Industries is India's most valued firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, HUL and SBI.

377.title: Don't wish to seek validation of my work basis on some list: Yami
377.article_body: Yami Gautam has said, "I don't wish to seek validation of my work, of my existence in this industry basis on some list." Yami added she believes that work should be done the right way. Recently, Yami called a critic's review of her performance in 'Dasvi' "extremely disrespectful" on Twitter. "There's only so much you can do as...actor," she added.

378.title: 18 people killed after overloaded truck rams into cliff in Indonesia
378.article_body: At least 18 people were killed after an overloaded truck carrying 29 people rammed into a cliff and flipped over in Indonesia's West Papua province on Wednesday. The truck, carrying miners and their families, was en route to the province's capital Manokwari. Survivors said that the truck's engine lost power while going up the hill and rolled backward before crashing.

379.title: St Stephen's in DU to give 85% weightage to CUET score for admission
379.article_body: St Stephen's College of Delhi University has decided to give 85% weightage of CUET scores and 15% of the interview marks for all categories of applicants. DU Vice-chancellor Yogesh Singh had recently directed colleges to solely consider Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores for general seats. A DU official said they are trying to sort it out with St Stephen's.

380.title: Mercedes are in a ‘better state’ after Aus GP: Mercedes team boss Wolff
380.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes are in a "better state" after the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "Clearly we haven't got the pace yet to challenge Ferrari and Red Bull but we know where we need to seek performance," Wolff said. Mercedes' George Russell finished third while teammate Lewis Hamilton finished fourth in the Australian Grand Prix in Melbourne.

381.title: Rishi Kapoor's scoldings had lot of love: 'Sharmaji...' actor Taaruk
381.article_body: Actor Taaruk Raina, who played Rishi Kapoor's son in the film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', has said that the late actor would get angry or upset during the film's shoot, scold them and then forget. "All of us have been scolded by him. But 'unki daant mein bohot pyar tha' (his scoldings had a lot of love in it)," the actor added.

382.title: Ukraine is a 'crime scene': ICC Chief Prosecutor after visiting Bucha
382.article_body: International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan described Ukraine as a "crime scene" after visiting Bucha on Wednesday. Khan's comments came as an ICC team visited Ukraine to probe allegations of war crimes amid the Russian invasion. Bodies of 403 people have been recovered from Bucha so far, following a retreat by Russian troops, Bucha's Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk said.

383.title: World no. 5 Tsitsipas beat Fognini to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
383.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas on Tuesday beat Fabio Fognini 6-3, 6-0 to reach the round of 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "Great things out there. I was able to really perform close to my best and deliver the result that I did," Tsitsipas said. Tsitsipas will face either Lorenzo Sonego or Laslo Djere next.

384.title: Stop matching single men with lone female Ukrainian refugees: UN to UK
384.article_body: The UN's refugee agency UN High Commissioner for Refugees has said that the UK government must intervene to stop matching single British men with lone Ukrainian women and children escaping the war amid fears of sexual exploitation. UNHCR has called for a "more appropriate matching process" for those who want to offer a shelter for the refugees.

385.title: BJP troubled by unity in Raj, trying to create communal tension: Gehlot
385.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday alleged that BJP was troubled by the unity in the state and was trying to create communal tensions. If any person tries to disturb peace in Rajasthan, strict action will be taken against them, Gehlot said, on a day BJP MP Tejasvi Surya and other BJP leaders were stopped from visiting Karauli.

386.title: Virat Kohli catches up with Mukesh Choudhary after getting out to him, CSK share pic
386.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli met CSK fast bowler Mukesh Choudhary after getting out to him in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Sharing a picture of the duo on Instagram, CSK wrote, "Catching up after the match up at the middle." Kohli was dismissed for one run off three deliveries as RCB lost to CSK by 23 runs.

387.title: Man Utd close to signing Ajax's Ten Hag as next manager: Reports
387.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly close to signing Ajax manager Erik ten Hag as their new manager. Ten Hag has emerged as the preferred choice for Manchester United after a round of preliminary interviews. Ten Hag, 52, is set to become the fifth permanent manager to take over the club since Sir Alex Ferguson retired in 2013.

388.title: We're sad that some lives couldn't be saved: PM on J'khand ropeway accident
388.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke to personnel who carried out rescue operation in Jharkhand's Deoghar where three people died in cable car accident. PM Modi said, "We are saddened that we could not save some people...I pray for speedy recovery of those injured." Praising the security personnel, he said, "Over the course of three days, you...completed a difficult operation."

389.title: Man's shirt catches fire as birthday cake candle bursts in Mumbai, pic surfaces
389.article_body: A sparkling candle on a cake burst during a birthday celebration in Mumbai's Ambernath, injuring a man. The man was trying to blow up the candle before cutting the cake, while his friends threw wheat flour and eggs on him to prank him. The candle suddenly burst and the man's shirt caught fire.

390.title: Same-sex marriage is against Indian culture, laws: UP govt to HC
390.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Government told Allahabad High Court that recognising same-sex marriage would be against Indian culture, laws and Indic religions. "As per the Indian law and culture, a biological husband and biological wife [are] essential for marriage...In their absence, homosexual marriage cannot be recognised as it lacks male and female, and neither can they produce children," it stated.

391.title: Hindu mahant who threatened to rape Muslim women arrested in UP
391.article_body: Hindu mahant Bajrang Muni Das, who had allegedly threatened to rape Muslim women, has been arrested, Sitapur SP RP Singh said on Wednesday. "He'll be presented in the court soon," he added. "If you harass one Hindu woman, then I will openly abduct your sisters and daughters and rape them," Das said earlier. Later, he claimed the video was distorted.

392.title: My last few days as bachelor, happy they're finally ending: Millind
392.article_body: Ahead of his wedding with Pria Beniwal, singer Millind Gaba has said, "These are my last few days as a bachelor. I'm happy they're finally ending, I'll have someone to look after me." Millind further said that marriage is a new chapter in his life. "I've known Pria for four years now, so the understanding, compatibility, chemistry...is there," he added.

393.title: 5 chimpanzees rescued in Assam; 2 suspected traffickers arrested
393.article_body: As many as five chimpanzees have been rescued from a vehicle and two suspected traffickers arrested in Assam's Karbi Anglong district, police said on Wednesday. Police intercepted the vehicle during a routine check near the Assam-Nagaland border on the previous night and found the animals inside. The animals have been handed over to the forest officials in the district.

394.title: 'Ranbir-Alia's wedding is tomorrow,' confirm Riddhima, Neetu
394.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's mother Neetu Kapoor and sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni on Wednesday confirmed to the paparazzi that the actor and Alia Bhatt will marry on April 14. "Kal shaadi hai (Tomorrow is the wedding)," Riddhima said when the paparazzi asked for a confirmation on the wedding date. Neetu said the wedding will take place at Vastu, Ranbir's Mumbai residence.

395.title: Don't view expenditure on armed forces as burden on economy: Army Chief
395.article_body: Expenditure made on armed forces should not be viewed as a burden on the country's economy, said Chief of Army Staff General Manoj Mukund Naravane on Wednesday. "For a country to prosper, you need a stable and peaceful environment. That will happen only if you have strong-armed forces that will secure your borders," he said.

396.title: He penetrated me with liquor bottle: Amber Heard as she accuses Depp of sexual assault
396.article_body: Johnny Depp allegedly "penetrated Amber Heard with an alcohol bottle", his ex-wife's lawyer told court during Depp's defamation trial. "He has her jammed up against the bar. He has hurled bottles...at her. He has dragged her across the floor...And then, he penetrates her with a liquor bottle," the lawyer said. Depp's spokesperson denied the claims.

397.title: Delhi's COVID-19 tally rises by 50% in 24 hrs with 299 fresh cases
397.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 299 fresh COVID-19 cases, a nearly 50% rise in new infections since Tuesday when the national capital logged 202 cases. As per the health bulletin, the positivity rate stands at 2.49% but no deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. Over 12,000 tests were conducted and 173 patients were discharged or recovered.

398.title: Firms must recall batches of EVs that caught fire: NITI Aayog CEO
398.article_body: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Wednesday said original equipment manufacturers should voluntarily recall batches of electric vehicles (EVs) involved in the recent fire accidents. Kant said the move will help in creating a sense of confidence among consumers. Adding that every transition has had its own challenges, Kant said "there's nothing to panic about" regarding the safety of EVs.

399.title: Cong exits Akbar Road office, whose rent was unpaid since '13: Reports
399.article_body: Congress on Tuesday started shifting its Sewa Dal office from 26, Akbar Road in New Delhi weeks after an RTI reply revealed that its monthly rent was unpaid since 2013, claimed reports. A senior Congress leader claimed that new rooms are being constructed at the party's headquarters at 24, Akbar Road to make space for the Sewa Dal office.

400.title: Monitor lizard gangraped in Maharashtra, video found on accused men's phone
400.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly gangraping a Bengal monitor lizard in the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve in Maharashtra. The officials of the Maharashtra Forest Department said that they found a video of the act on the accused's phone. The accused will be produced in a court and appropriate legal action will be taken against them, officials said.

401.title: Centre should have objected to Blinken's remarks on rights abuses: Pawar
401.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Wednesday that Centre should have objected to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's remarks on 'rise in rights abuses' in India. "[This] statement made by...US in front of our ministers...is detrimental for [India]," he added. Blinken said on Tuesday that US was monitoring "concerning developments", including rights abuses in India.

402.title: Time to speak on inflation, unemployment: Pawar on loudspeaker remark
402.article_body: Responding to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's comment on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar said it's time to speak on "inflation and unemployment, but no one speaks on it". Raj Thackeray on Tuesday warned of state wide protests if the state government failed to remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

403.title: Guidelines to pursue 2 full-time degrees at the same time released by UGC
403.article_body: The University Grants Commission has released the guidelines for students who want to pursue two full-time UG or PG academic programmes simultaneously. The guidelines state that the students can pursue the two programmes in physical mode if their classes don't overlap or they can pursue one of them in online or open and distance learning mode.

404.title: US mother uses iPhone feature to track car stolen with 9-yr-old son inside it
404.article_body: A US mother helped police locate her car, which was stolen with her nine-year-old son inside, using Apple's 'Find My iPhone' feature. "With the assistance of the victim, officers used 'my location' technology on the child's iPhone and began canvassing the immediate area," police said. The car was located, the suspect was arrested and the child appeared to be uninjured.

405.title: Raj Thackeray booked for wielding sword during rally in Thane
405.article_body: A case has been registered against MNS chief Raj Thackeray, Thane MNS president Avinash Jadhav and party worker Ravindra More for allegedly wielding a sword during the political rally held in Thane on Tuesday. "We filed a case against the three under the Arms Act, Section 4 and Section 25 on Wednesday," an officer from Naupada Police said.
